text:
This was good but I thought it could be much better (and faster) if you skipped the first step. Baking the chicken on a baking sheet makes it dry and bland. I made it again last night and it was so much better (5 star). I sautéed the spinach and mushrooms in a little butter and placed in bottom of dish then placed the uncooked chicken on top, added the sauce and topped it off with real crumbled bacon and baked for 25 minutes at 350.  Removed from oven and topped with 1 cup mozzarella and continued baking for 10 minutes at 350 (not 400). It was so moist and flavorful!

text:
THIS IS DELICIOUS!!!  I did modify.  As others suggested I sauted (I used a bag and a half) of baby spinach leaves with (I used sliced portabella) mushrooms. I added a splash of white cooking wine and a teaspoon of garlic to the baby spinach/mushroom mix.  I sauted as long as I could without burning to get rid of as much moisture as possible then put mixture over bottom of baking dish. Meanwhile, I boiled my chicken then cut into cubes.  I then mixed and simmered my white sauce in the pan I sauted the spinach/mushroom ingredients, to take up the flavor. I stirred the cubed chicken in with the white sauce. I then poured the entire chicken/white sauce mixture over the layer of spinach and mushrooms.  I crushed up cooked real bacon I had on hand and sprinkled over top then finished with the mozza cheese. It baked beautifully! YUMMY!

text:
This is now one of my favorite dishes!  I do make quite a few changes based on reviews, but it comes out as an incomparably excellent dish that I would be proud to serve to company! My hubby stated it tastes like a meal at one of those "fancy restaurants". :)  My changes were as follows: 1. I fried 4 pieces of bacon on the stove. 2. In the bacon grease, I sauteed the chicken which I had cut into bite-sized pieces and the garlic. I added half of the chicken chunks in with the sauce and the other half I laid on top of the spinach and mushrooms and poured the sauce over. 3. In the bacon/chicken juice, I sauteed fresh spinach leaves (1 bag of prewashed) and the mushrooms. 4.  I used 1% milk instead of half and half.  5. I put 1 cup of Mozz. in the sauce and 1 cup on top of the casserole.  6. I baked at 350 for about 30 mins and put the last cup of cheese on the last 10 mins.  I baked in a covered casserole dish until about 10 mins were left.  When I added the cheese, I left the casserole uncovered.  Lastly, I served over angel hair pasta with "Summerly Squash" w/ veggies from my veggie garden, and it was a nice compliment to the entree. This was a PERFECTLY delicious meal, and I'm so excited about the leftovers! ;) Thanks for the great recipe!

text:
Oh my goodness this recipe is GREAT! The different flavors meshed wonderfully together. I saved myself a lot of time and stress changing just a few things. Those changes were: 1.) cut up chicken into chunks 2.) cooked chicken and minced garlic together in a pan with a few tablespoons of olive oil 3.) After chicken was cooked, I added the soup, milk instead half-and-half, 6 oz. shredded mozzarella, and lemon juice. 4.) Stired it all up on medium heat til creamy and then poured the entire mix on top of the spinach (I used frozen; turned out just fine) and mushroom layer as stated in the recipe. I then crumbled real bacon on the top and baked for 25 minutes. We ate it on top of bowtie pasta. This is DEFINITELY a keeper!!! So easy to make and so delicious! Thanks =)

text:
Made a few changes with what I had on hand...I used milk instead of the half and half.  I made my own bacon bits and sauteed the chicken in the bacon grease, just a few minutes on each side.  Then, put that off to the side and added the mushrooms and the garlic to the pan with just a little butter and olive oil.  I deglazed the pan with a splash of white wine and added the soup milk mixture.  I forgot all about the lemon juice and reduced the seasonings to 1/2 because of the comments from other reviewers.  Baked this for 20 minutes and then added the cheese for another 10 minutes at 350.  Served it with Roasted Garlic Wild Rice and it was delicious.  Definately a keeper.  Thanks for the recipe.

text:
Just made this for dinner tonight and my husband and I loved it.  I cut the chicken into bite size pieces and sauteed them in a little olive oil and minced garlic until cooked thru.  Removed the chicken and wilted some fresh spinach in the chicken juice that was left in the pan.  Removed and squeezed dry.  I did not use butter or lemon juice.  Just mixed together mushroom soup, fat free half and half, parmesan and 1 tsp of Italian seasoning.  Stirred chicken and spinach into the soup mixture, poured into a pie plate and just sprinkled a little additional parmesan cheese on top.  Served over angel hair spaghetti.  The sauce is wonderful!  To cut way down on the fat in this recipe, I omitted the butter, bacon bits and mozzarella cheese and used fat free half and half and it still tasted delicious.

text:
I doubled this recipe for a casual dinner party with my college friends and they loved it. Of course, anything home-cooked is better than the food they serve at the campus cafeteria, but this recipe was easy and delicious.

I took some advice from fellow reviewers and cut up the chicken into bite-size pieces and cooked it on the stove top with some onion and a pinch of salt.

For the sauce, I put all of the cheese in the pot (instead of sprinkling on top) and I used 3/4 cup 2% milk instead of a whole cup so it wouldn't be too runny. I also only added one tablespoon each of the garlic and Italian seasoning (again, I doubled the recipe). Either way though, I think that if I made 4 servings, I'd still use a little less Italian seasoning, because 1 tbsp was plenty.

In the end, I sprayed the pan and put cooked penne on the bottom, topped that with chopped up broccoli, then the chicken. Since it was already done, I put it, uncovered, in a 350 degree oven for 15 min. just to heat it through.

Served with the Cheddar Bay Biscuits from this site...awesome!

Great recipe; thanks!

Pretty good overall.  I saute the chicken rather than bake, as baking can tend to dry out the chicken.  Also, I use about 1/2 a bag of fresh (washed and dried) spinach spread out evenly on the bottom of the pan.  I also add a splash of white wine. This has a "sophisticated" taste that is good enough for company.

text:
Excellent! My chicken-loathing boyfried even after the leftovers the next night! Taking some of the other reviews into account, I browned the chicken on top the stove and used two bags of pre-washed fresh spinach.  I also opted for milk rather than cream.  The resulting casserole was a bit 'saucier' than I expected but I cooked it in the oven for about an hour because the pieces of chicken were so huge!  However, the chicken was so tender you could cut it with a fork.  

I never know whether or not to cover a casserole unless the directions specify that, so I put a cover on this one.  Maybe that was why it had more liquid.  But don't let my results sway you!  This is an excellent dish!!!

The only thing I 'might' add would be a small amount (1/4 cup) of chopped onion to give more flavor to the spinach.

text:
I love rich, creamy dishes, and expected to love this one. Oddly enough, it was too rich for me. (I didn't know this was possible.)   I followed the recipe pretty closely, except I used frozen spinach instead of canned (thawed, with excess moisture squeezed out), I did not pre-bake the chicken, and I used whole milk instead of half-and-half. I may make this again with half the cheese or with some chicken broth added to dilute the sauce a little. I loved the flavor, it was just too heavy for me somehow.

text:
I have made this recipe many times and my family loves it!  The bacon, spinach and mushroom flavors are so yummy together.  I have modified it to be more kid friendly because I have some picky eaters.  I cut the chicken into bite size pieces and sautee them in a little bit of oil in a skillet.  In the sauce I use 2 cans of soup and 1 cup of milk (instead 1/2 cup of half and half).  This makes it more saucy which works better for serving over noodles.  For the spinach I use fresh and I sautee it in a little butter and garlic salt and then I blend it up to make a smooth green base for the casserole.  (My kids love the green part the best and they don't even know it is spinach!).  I also omit the mushroom layer.  We serve it over pasta for a complete meal.

text:
MY HUSBAND LICKED THE BOWL!  This will be one he asks for again and again! I incorporated many of the recommended changes per previous reviews. I fried 4 pieces of bacon until crisp (set aside and crumbled), then browned 1 pound chicken tenders in the bacon fat, then I removed the chicken and wilted fresh baby spinach with the mushrooms in the same pan.  I used skim milk and the regular cream of mushroom soup (though I did notice that campbell's now has a cream of mushroom with roasted garlic option).  I only used 2 teaspoons italian seasoning and added fresh ground black pepper.  Finally, I only used 1 cup of shredded mozzarella.  This recipe was also good with vegetarian bacon (Morning Star Farms) and next time I will try the Healthy Request Cream of Mushroom because it has less Sodium and I find the recipe a bit salty.  Bon appetite!

text:
I am not sure how to rate this since the original recipe needs some serious cutbacks on fat (38.7 g/serving) and salt (1844 mg/serving), but has great flavor. The ingredient combination is very appealing.   I adjusted the salt level by using fresh spinach and using my own mushroom soup-sauce instead of canned. I only used 2 T butter to saute the garlic and also sauteed about 3/4 c. of onion and 2 minced mushrooms before proceeding to make the soup/sauce with 2 T. flour, 1 T. lemon juice, 1 3/4 c. skim milk, 1/3 c. white wine, and  1/2 c. reduced fat sour cream.  I omitted the bacon and used grilled chicken breasts which provided smokey flavor.  I used a 13x9 inch glass baking dish, sprayed with Canola oil, and layered: cooked rigatoni pasta--just enough to cover the bottom, fresh spinach leaves, fresh mushrooms, half of the sauce, 1/2 c. mozzarella, grilled chicken breast sliced thin, the other half of the sauce, 1 c. mozzarella, and a sprinkling of parsley. As I was adding the mozzarella to the top, I stopped when the surface was covered using 1/2 c. less than the recipe called for.  I thought this was full of flavor with the adjustments and see no need to ruin it with excess fat and salt. I'll make this again with the changes as it becomes a 5 star recipe.  Thanks for a great recipe idea.

Loved recipe! Seared Chicken in large skillet in about 2 TBLS Olive oil, cooked breasts almost all the way thru, let cool then cubed . Then put the butter & lemon juice in the pan to scrape up browned pieces, this made for a much richer sauce and made the process faster.  Added garlic and let it brown then added soup, and 1/2 & 1/2 then followed recipe the rest of the way except I used frozen/thawed spinach, much better flavor and texture than canned not to mention it's better for you! Big Hit!

Zen

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Like Previous reviewers, I made a few changes to make this my own 5 star recipe.  It truly is guest worthy.  I sauteed a bag of fresh spinach, pack of fresh sliced mushrooms, 2 cloves of garlic and pat of butter until wilted.  I then poured this mixture on the bottom of a 9x 13 pan.  I pounded out 3 boneless skinless chicken breasts, seasoned them with salt and pepper and layed them on top of the spinach mixture.  I poured a jar of Classico alfredo sauce on top of the breasts and sprinkled a light dusting of Italian seasoning - maybe half a teaspoon.  I squeezed about 2 tablespoons of fresh lemon juice all over and baked uncovered for 35 minutes at 350 degrees.  Then I opened oven and added a generous sprinkling of mozzarella cheese and fresh flat leaf parsley and baked for an additional 10 minutes.  I removed from oven and let stand for 10 minutes.  Pure heaven...tender, juicy and so tasty.  A great marriage of flavors for this chicken dish.

text:
I've made this dish twice now, once for my husband and once for my mother, and it's an absolutely lovely dish. It goes very nicely with red wine and some asparagus or green beans on the side. I took the advice of another reviewer and didn't bake the chicken but put everything together in a casserole and baked it all together. I highly recommend doing it this way. With this change, this is definitely a keeper and most certainly company-worthy.
Review:
Rating:
4
dateLastModified:
2009-06-23T08:18:16.593
helpfulCount:
9
userID:
191796
Display Name:
Lyndsay
isPro:
False
followersCount:
1
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
67
favoritesCount:
470
recipesCount:

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/3541314.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I give my own version 5 stars, but my changes were enough for me to have to give it 4 stars as is.  Here's what I did... Chopped then fried 5-6 pieces of bacon, set aside  Sautéed the spinach and mushrooms with garlic, red pepper flakes, salt, pepper and a little white wine (from my glass) in the bacon grease   Removed the spinach and mushrooms, placed in the bottom of the baking dish and sprinkled half of the bacon on top, then sautéed 3 chicken breasts (cut in chunks) with more garlic, some more white wine, salt, pepper, crushed red pepper  While the chicken was sautéing, I melted ½ a stick of butter in a sauce pan, then added ½ and ½ (probably about a cup), squeezed in the juice of half a lemon, some Italian seasoning (about a tablespoon), more red pepper flakes, salt, pepper, garlic and whisked until it boiled.  Once the chicken was just done, I added it to the top of the spinach/mushroom mix, topped it with the rest of the bacon and deglazed the pan with more white wine before adding my butter/cream mixture. Then about ¾ cup of parmesan cheese to thicken the sauce… Once the parmesan had melted enough and the sauce was thick enough I poured it over the top of the chicken.  Baked for 20 minutes at 400, then added 1 cup or more of mozzarella cheese to the top and baked for about 10 minutes longer. Served over farfalle.   RAVE reviews from my date – we both felt like we were in heaven eating this.  So, so good.

WOW!! This dish rivals ones found in your favorite Italian chains.  I used a bag of fresh baby spinach instead of canned and doubled the recipe.  Even my teenagers ate the spinach.  Definitely serve with paste.  I did not bake the chicken first, but instead browned the breasts off in an elelectric skillet and set aside while preparing the sauce.  I have also made the sauce and added a can of chicken (or two) and served over pasta for a quick and easy meal.  The fat can be reduced with using 1% fat milk and fat free soup with no change to the taste.  This dish has already become a family favorite.

I then poured it over  al dente spiral noodles in a deep dish casserole, mixed in 2 cups of mozarella covered with foil, and baked for about 30 to 40 mins.  Awesome!

YUMMY! My husband looooooved it too because it's low carb and still so, so tasty. I followed the tips by VICSGARDEN to saute the spinach and mushrooms and then put the uncooked chicken on top followed by the sauce then real bacon bits (then cook at 350 for 25 mins then top with mozarella and cook for another 10 minutes). It already ends up with a lot of moisture so it was a good tip (I used the canned spinach). I substituted whole milk for the half and half because that is what I had. Seriously yummy for a not too difficult meal. Don't skip the bacon - it really adds to it.

text:
This recipe revolves around the extremely luscious sauce.  It is very rich - not for those who don't like a heavy sauce.  I loved it, but will try it with milk in place of the half-n-half next time.  I did use canned spinach, drained and pressed between paper towels to get ALL of the water out, and it was fine.  It would save time to use frozen.  I also used fish, (orange roughy) as the recipe says it can be used in place of the chicken.  The fish was a bit too delicate to stand up to the heavy sauce, so next time I will use either chicken or salmon, a less "fluffy" fish.  Definately use real bacon, or the real bacon bits.  Fake ones won't cut it.  All in all, this is an awesome dish, and as my husband said, "this tastes like something you would pay $20 for in a restaurant."  If you like gourmet cuisine - try it.  It's really that good!

text:
Great recipe.  I made a few changes to make it alot easier.  I doubled the recipe to fit a 9x13 pan.  I cut the chicken breast into bite size pieces and cooked with 3 tsp minced garlic.  While chicken was cooking I sauteed the mushrooms. After chicken was done I added 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup, 1 cup half-and-half, 2 tbs lemon juice,1 tbs  italian seasoning, 3/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese, 3oz bag of bacon bits, frozen spinach add as much or as little as you like, 4 oz of sauteed mushrooms, 1/2 bag of cooked egg noodles.   Place in pan, bake at 350 for 20 mins. Top with Mozzarella cheese and cheese fried onions which adds texture and taste.  Bake additional 20 mins or until hot and enjoy.

I took the advice of the top reviews and this was spectacular!  I sauteed a bag of fresh spinach and sliced mushrooms with butter and garlic.  Placed them in a dish, topped with raw cubed chicken and then the sauce.  I used whole milk instead of cream and 98% fat free cream of mushroom soup.  I cooked up bacon, chopped it and placed it on top.  Baked for 25 mins at 350, put the cheese on top and baked for 10 mins.  It was so delicious!  It tasted like something I could get at a restaurant.  Next time after I sautee the spinach mixture and remove it from the pan, I will add the cubed chicken and brown it slightly before putting it in the dish.  My cubed chicken stuck together while baking when I added it completely raw.  I will also use more than 4oz mushrooms and more bacon as I only cut up 7 pieces this time.

This is one of my all time favorite recipes! You can divide this recipe in half by two baking pie pans and freeze the other for a rainy day. This is also a good one to cook for yourself and give the other half for a friend (i.e. funeral). I did do some changes as recommend by others: didn't do step 1, I sautéed the spinach and mushrooms in a little butter and placed in bottom of dish then placed the uncooked chicken on top, added the sauce and topped it off with real crumbled bacon and baked for 25 minutes at 350. text:
The sauce in this casserole is fantastic.  I replaced the half-an-half with heavy cream because it comes in a smaller carton (less leftover)!  I tried the canned spinach and it was kind of nasty - use 10 oz thawed frozen instead (or fresh).  I doubled the mushrooms and used Morning Star bacon strips (soy) which are better than bacon bits.  Like other reviewers, I simplified by cubing the raw chicken (I used 1 lb) and sauteing it with the mushrooms.  Then I added the sauce ingredients and 1 cup of the mozzarella.  I baked for 20 minutes at 350, topped with the other cup of mozzarella and baked for 10 more minutes.  I'm not a huge fan of spinach, so I tried it with broccoli once, but it just didn't work.  Tried it with pasta as well, but I thought it detracted from the sauce.

Very good!  Based upon other reviews, made a few adjustments that worked well.  I cooked 5 strips of bacon first, drained grease and then cut up chicken into bite sized pieces and then cooked chicken in bacon grease in large skillet.  Used one 9 ounce bag of FRESH spinach & sauteed with the mushrooms in EVOO and a clove of garlic.  One bag of spinach was fine for us but more would have been okay too. As for the sauce, used 2% milk instead of half & half and also cut back Italian seasoning to 1 teaspoon and that was plenty!  Took the advise of adding the chicken into the sauce before pouring over the spinach/mushrooms.  Everything else done as written.  Served with bow tie pasta. text:
Good the second time around.  First time I followed the recipe, and both my husband and I thought it was okay.  Second time around, I used fresh spinach and mushrooms, sauteed those in a pan with a little bit of olive oil.  I skipped the prebaking chicken step.  In the baking pan, I put the spinach down first, then the chicken, topped with the sauce, real bacon bits, and mozzi cheese.  Much better with fresh spinach.

text:
My husband has a new favorite! This was delicious and easy to make. I did what other reviewers suggested skipped baking the chicken first. I first sauteed the spinach and mushrooms together. Then spread it on the bottom of the baking dish and placed cubed uncooked chicken pieces on top, covered with the sauce mixture and then the bacon bits. Baked at 350 for 25 minutes and then topped it with the mozzarella and bakes it for another 10 mins at 350. Great dish!

text:
This was SO TASTEY!  So many flavors that went extremely well together! My husband and kids loved it to pieces and my oldest son, who's the pickiest eater, even asked for seconds! I did make some changes though. I used cream of chicken soup instead of the mushroom soup, 1/2 cup of 2% milk instead of half and half, 2 cans of french style green beans instead of spinach, and no mushrooms because my husband is allergic. Then I skipped the first step and just baked it all together at 400 degrees for 30 minutes, took it out and sprinkled the cheese on top, then continued cooking at 400 degrees for about 10 more minutes. It tasted AMAZING!

userID:
2841720
Display Name:
Katie
isPro:

followersCount:
1

favoritesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/355435.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
If I made this recipe as written, I probably would have only given it 4 stars but since I made a few changes based on the other reviews, it is absolutely 5 stars!  I'm not a big spinach or mushroom fan but I LOVED this!  I pretty much copied what another reviewer did word for word.  I first fried 5 pieces of bacon in a frying pan and then sauteed the chicken (cut into bite sized pieces) in the bacon grease.  I then sauteed the spinach (used 1 bag of fresh prewashed instead of canned) and mushrooms in the bacon grease/chicken juice.  I added 1/2 c. mozzerella to the sauce and sprinkled another cup on top for the last 10 minutes of baking -- the mozz browned beautifully only being in uncovered for 10 mins -- I also covered with foil for the first 1/2 of baking before I put the cheese on.  I know cooking in the bacon grease isn't the healthiest way to go but it sure did add tons of flavor!  I served over angel hair seasoned with a little basil and butter (to keep the pasta from sticking).  SOOOOO good!

text:
Amazing!  I made some changes based on other reviews.  I cubed the chicken, seasoned it with Montreal Steak seasoning and sauteed it.  I then sauteed 10 oz of sliced mushrooms and wilted a bag of baby spinach.  I also used less butter in the sauce.  The only thing I would do differently next time is to reduce or even omit the shredded cheese on top.  It is already quite a heavy dish and I didn't think the cheese really added to it.  I served this over rice and my whole family was licking their plates!  I would definitely serve this to company.  We will make this again!

text:
Full of flavor. I too skipped the step of baking the chicken prior. I cooked the bacon then sauted the spiniach (one large bag) and mushrooms in the bacon fat. Layered the dish with the spinach, mushrooms then the chopped raw chicken (3 breasts) on top, sprinkled with the bacon (really added to the flavor and texture of this dish) cooked at 350 for 25 min then sprinkled the cheese and cooked an additional 10 min. I forgot to purchase the half and half. As a result my sauce came out way to thin but still full of flavor. Served with Angel Hair pasta. My husband and friend raved about it. Thank You!

Super delicious!  I modified the recipe to make it a little healthier and to suit our tastes by using Healthy Choice cream of chicken, fat free half and half, frozen spinach (thawed and drained), broccoli rather than mushrooms, about 1/3 c. bacon bits and 1 c. part-skim mozzarella.   I also cut up the chicken and sauteed it in 1 tbsp olive oil rather than baking it off.  Will definitely make again!

I read most of the reviews before I prepared this recipe.  I agree, the chicken would be dry if baked. I pan seared thin chicken fillets in a small amount of butter in a pan. Romoved the chicken from the pan and sauted sliced portabello mushrooms and one pound of fresh baby spinach in the same pan. I followed the recipe directions for the white sauce exactly.  I thought one tablespoon of Italian seasoning was overpowering.  I will use about a tsp. next time.  It also needed salt.  This was a wonderful dish served over angel hair pasta.

after reading all reviews, I decided to try this recipe. OMW, I don't even know what to say. It was nothing short of spectacular!! It is far superior to anything I have ever eaten in any Italian restaurant anywhere. I did make a few changes.  fried my own bacon and used the pan drippings instead of butter, used fresh spinach, added a sliced sweet onion to bacon and cooked together, used skim milk instead of 1/2 and 1/2 and 5 cheese Italian blend instead of Mozz. cheese. text:
I absolutely LOVE this recipe! I, like many others, changed a few things: I first cooked some bacon in a large skillet, and set the bacon aside to crumble later. I then seared the chicken in the bacon grease & set aside.  I then sauteed the onion & mushroom for a couple of minutes, then added 1 bag fresh spinach and couple cloves of fresh garlic. Place mixture in the bottom of the dish, then place the chicken on top.  I did the sauce just the same, but I might use a little less Italian seasoning next time! (Maybe 1/2 - 3/4 Tbsp. Italian season.) Add the sauce and top it off with the reserved crumbled bacon and bake for 25 minutes at 350. Remove from oven and top with 1 cup mozzarella and continue baking for 10 minutes at 350. I also served it all on a bed of buttered angel hair pasta. Serve w/ side salad & crusty garlic bread! YUM!!

text:
What a great recipe!  I used all the same ingredients... but prepared it slightly differently.  First I sauted 1 large bag of fresh spinach with mushrooms in a little butter until all the moisture was out.  Placed those in bottom of pan.  Then, I browned the chicken in the same skillet for about 3 minutes on each side.  I added ALL sauce ingredients to the pan and gently stirred until mixed well around chicken, brought to light bubble, and poured over spinach/mushroom mix.  Topped with bacon and baked @ 350 for 25 minutes, topped with mozz cheese and baked at 350 for 10 more minutes.  AMAZING!!! Great flavor and the chicken was SO moist!

text:
Excellent.
Changes I made since I doubled the recipe:
Sautéed garlic and 8 oz fresh mushrooms in olive oil versus butter.
Seasoned chicken and cooked on top of stove versus oven.
In addition to 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup (used 98% fat free) – I added 1 can condensed 98% Fat Free Cream of Chicken Soup, Can’t tell the difference at all.
Used at least 1 ½ cups half-and-half
2 boxes frozen spinach - thawed
3 pre-baked medium potatoes
Used no bacon.

Cut up cooked chicken and mixed with spinach.  Spread on the bottom of 9 x 13 baking dish.
Cut up potatoes and layered on top of chicken/spinach mixture.
Covered with special sauce and toped with mozzarella – sprinkled with dried basil.
Baked at 350 until hot and bubbly and it came out DELISH

text:
I thought the flavor was great but a little too rich.  I followed the advise of some reviewers: I sauteed fresh mushrooms and spinach (2 bags baby spinach), placed on the bottom of the casserole dish.  Then I sauteed cubed chicken (I'd use at least 5-6 breasts next time) in the same pan until it was moslty cooked, placing the chicken in the casserole.  I splashed in some white wine during these first two steps.  I then made the sauce (directions # 3 in recipe), but will use fat free half-n-half next time.  Baked the casserole for 25 min, then back in oven with crumbled real bacon & mozzarella on the top; this added a good flavor, but I see no need for the mozzarella - it was good, but it's just such a rich dish.  I may melt SmartBalance w/ breadcrumbs next time on top w/crumbled bacon.

text:
I just made this for my Dad and Stepmom. My Dad raved and said it was a restaurant quality dish. I know that everyone tweaks recipes to their liking, and I've read many reviews stating this recipe is perfect, and other reviews stating it was either not salty enough, or too salty, or not a healthy dish, or the chicken tasted bland, etc. Here is what I did to this dish - I think the salt content is right for my taste, and its a little bit more healthy: I used 1/2 butter, 1/2 olive oil, no lemon juice, no bacon bits (ewh!), fat free half andd half, real grated parmesean cheese (no processed stuff), 1 box of frozen spinach whole leaves (drained well), and instead of italian seasoning, a mixture of majoram, rosemary, sage, thyme, andd oregano, to equal about 3/4 tablespoon. I very lightly salted the spinach (a pinch or two) and sprinkled garlic salt and white pepper on the chicken prior to it going into the oven.

text:
Making things fast and easy, I had to change a couple of things. 
I like my chicken little, so I had to cut the chicken into cube/ bite size pieces. On the skillet (with butter and garlic), sauté for 15 minutes (or until no longer pink), season with seasoning salt & pepper. Once cooked add in olive oil, Italian seasoning, cream of mushroom soup, half-and-half, lemon juice, ½ of the mozz cheese and ½ the parmesan cheese. (Adding everything one at a time) a minute before taking off the stove add in the mushrooms, I had to double them because they’re so good.  In the glass pan spread 1 can of spinach (1 is enough) sprinkle with bacon bits and pour in the chicken mixture. Top with remaining mozz cheese and parmesan cheese. Cover and bake for 30 minutes on 350. This was so good!

Very good and my fiance loved it! I will   make again.  I had to make some changes because of the high calories and fat.  I cut the chicken in cubes and sauteed with garlic instead of baking. For the sauce, I used low-fat sour cream instead of half and half and added a splash of white wine.  I cut the butter in half, however next time I will omit it completely.  I did not use bacon.  I sauteed a bundle of fresh spinach with mushrooms and garlic. I spinkled the mozzerella cheese on top, probably using about 3/4 of a cup.   I served over angel hair pasta. Very flavorful!

text:
I liked this, but with major tweaking. I diced the chicken and sauted it with onion and garlic powders and pepper. Will use more spice next time, including sea salt. I made 8 oz. fettucine and stirred together that, the chicken, the spinach (I used the frozen thawed spinach per other reviewers suggestions, about 8 0z.) mushrooms,and half the cheese together. I poured the sauce on top and stirred it all up. There's too much Italian seasoning for my taste, I will only use 1/2 tbsp. next time. Then I poured it all in to a 9 x 13 pan and topped with fresh bacon bits and remaining mozzarella. The bacon bits give it a nice, smoky flavor, but 1/3 cp. was plenty. Next time, I will use half the amount of chicken and twice the fettucine. Great base recipe, though!

text:
This was fantastic.  I made a few changes that I knew I would like better. I cooked the bacon and removed it from the skillet, then I cooked the mushrooms and some halved small artichoke hearts in the bacon drippings until slightly browned.  I removed the mushrooms and artichokes, and sauteed fresh baby spinach (it's what I had on hand) in the same skillet. I layered it spinach / uncooked chicken / mushrooms / artichokes / sauce / cheeese / chopped parsley.  I just cooked it until an instant read thermometer indicated the chicken was done.  We really enjoyed this and I will definately make it again.  I have no doubt the original preparation instructions are fine, but these small variations were more to my liking.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614256.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I thought this was a very good recipe although I did make a few alterations. I used 6 chicken breast halves for 6 people (in hindsight 4 would have been plenty) and cut them into big cubes. I didn't cook them ahead of time but put them raw on top of the veg and I doubled the sauce. I used two 'boxes' of organic baby spinach but it sure didn't look like much when slightly cooked so I added one big head of broccoli cut into tiny florets. I made my own Italian seasoning from a recipe on this website and had to cook it longer to get the chicken cubes in the centre of the pan cooked. I kept a close eye on it after 45 minutes to be sure the chicken was not overlooked. We served it on gluten-free penne pasta with a tossed salad. I kept all the ingredients (except for the broc) and proportions the same so the changes I made didn't really change the flavour or tone of the recipe but just made it easier to prepare.

I made this for family dinner and it was a hit.  I followed the basic recipe but made the following tweaks:  I sauteed a shallot and 3-4 minced garlic cloves then added the spinach and mushrooms to sautee.  I then put the spinach mixture in the baking dish and then added the uncooked chicken breasts.  Proceeded with the rest of the recipe and baked for about 45min at 400 degrees.  Chicken was very juicy.  Topped it with fresh chopped basil.  Added a lot of flavor!

I'm with VICSGARDEN on this one - there's no need to pre-cook the chicken and use all that cheese!  Follow his directions and you'll end up with a first rate Chicken Florentine.  In fact, this dish is so satisfying and filling, it'll stand up to any main dish I can think of, and with lots of nutrition to boot.  And, as always, the combination of flavors - chicken, cheese, mushrooms, spinach and bacon - is what makes this dish such a H-I-T at my house.

text:
I loved this recipe. I also changed a few things. I did NOT skip step one. Rather, I salt and peppered the chicken. If you cook the chicken to temperature, it will not be dry. Second,for the white sauce, I added cream of mushroom, 5 tablespoons of butter, 1/2 cup 2% milk, 1/2 cup parmesan cheese,1/4 onion, and 3 minced garlic cloves. My husband hates mushrooms so I substitued diced tomatoes. Next, I arranged the chicken and white sauce over the spinach and tomatoes,added lots of mozzarella cheese and then I added a refrigerated pie crust brushed with egg yolk on top of all of that! Delicious.

userID:
3804983
Display Name:
Vicky Ferrell Field
isPro:
False

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2618091.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Made this for dinner tonight. I had three large chicken breasts that I needed to stretch for dinner for five (ages 13 - 42). This recipe fit the bill perfectly.  I had to make a few changes based on what I had on hand and based on prior reviews. First, I cut up the chicken, seasoned it with Emeril's Pizza and Pasta seasoning and browned it in olive oil.  While that was going, I melted butter in another saucepan and sauteed a roughly chopped onion until tender, added the mushrooms and sauteed them, then added the spinach last and heated just until wilted.  I greased a 10 inch casserole pan and spread the spinach mixture in the bottom and topped with the seasoned chicken.  For the sauce, I used the same pan that I browned the chicken in.  I used cream of mushroom soup, almond milk (that's the only kind of milk I have on hand), feta cheese (didn't have any parmesan) and bottled lemon juice.  I added more of the Emeril's seasoning and some fresh cracked black pepper.  I whisked until smooth and heated through.   I poured the sauce over the cooked chicken then topped with a pizza blend cheese (didn't have any plain mozzarella) and then topped with the precooked bacon bits.  Baked at 350 for 30 minutes and it was SOOOOOOOOO good.  I think I'm going to make it like this all the time.  Thanks for posting such a versatile and forgiving recipe!!

text:
The only reason I gave this 5 stars is for all the changes I made.  This is a very fattening recipe at 647 calories per serving.  I used less butter, 1% milk, less sodium cream of mushroom.  I sauteed fresh spinach, mushrooms, garlic, and onion in olive oil and put at bottom of dish.  Then I added the chicken which I boiled.  Then I poured the white mixture on, added the fresh bacon and mozz cheese.  Next time I will mix the mozz into the other items so that it mixes better.  Great recipe, just needed a healthy touch and it tasted delicious!

text:
DELICIOUS!!!  I made this tonight as my 7 month old son sat nearby and it was a breeze and the result was SO good!  I used a pound of chicken breast and i cubed the chicken and skipped step 1 entirely.   I used half a bag of frozen chopped spinach in place of the canned spinach, omitted the bacon bits (didnt have any) and substituted provolone for the mozzarella.  I also only used half the amt of butter called for.  I cooked at 400 degrees for 30 mins, turned it down to 350 for another 15 minutes as I had to get my son to sleep, and came back to a bubbly and browned dish of goodness.  Served with steamed fresh green beans and brown rice.  Next time I will thaw and squeeze the spinach first because it did have a lot of liquid.  Overall, very yummy!  Thanks for this recipe.  I can't wait to make it for company!

Very tasty dish! I used a rotisserie chicken and shredded the breast meat. I didn't have Italian seasoning, so I used about 2 tsp. of Herbs de Provence. I sauteed the spinach, mushrooms, and garlic first to remove some of the moisture. I could've cooked it longer to remove more. VERY tasty! We'll make this again!

I used all the ingredients as is just substituted fresh spinach and real bacon and altered the technique a bit. text:
This was very good once I made a few alterations. I used fresh spinach and no mushrooms (because I didn't have any). I didn't cook the chicken beforehand, but I cut it into strips and only cooked it in the casserole at 350 for 35 minutes (just right!). 

It came out delicious but needing a little salt and a good bit of thickening. The sauce went on VERY thick, but I think the spinach and/or chicken must have watered it down. 

Next time I'd sprinkle about 2 T of flour over the bottom of the pan and sprinkle a little salt (1/2-1t.) over the chicken. After thickening the sauce and adding a touch of salt, it was great! (I think cooking the chicken first is a bad idea - ours was done perfectly in less time.)

text:
We made this last night but with a LOT of substitutions based on what we had.  We used shrimp as suggested by the poster, cream of chicken soup, I had mixed my herbs (basil, thyme, sage, oregano) to make Italian seasoning, milk not cream, fresh spinach wilted in a pan, no mushrooms and marble cheddar!  Looked and smelled beautiful, came out a little runny so I added some plain bread cubes I had to soak it up, and returned it to the oven for 10 min.  It was delicious and very hearty!  Try the bread cubes or even a few croutons if yours is runny too you won't be sorry!

This is really good.  I was able to put it together on a weeknight and it was on the table in about an hour.   In followed others advice and didn't bake the chicken first, but I did season it with Cajun seasoning, then seared it in a hot cast iron pan coated with olive oil. I served it over ziti.

text:
This is GREAT!  It's hard to know many stars to give the original recipe when I made it the first time based on reviewers' suggestions.  I roasted a whole chicken in an oven bag for 2 hrs 20 min.   I sauteed sliced mushrooms (16 oz) and garlic (an entire head) in butter, then added a few bags of chopped baby spinach and sauteed until it looked wilted.  I put that mixture in the bottom of a casserole dish.   I used the same frypan (deglazed with a splash of white wine) for the butter (1/4 c is WAY too much!), lemon juice, soup, Italian seasoning, half and half, and Parmesan cheese.  At this point I might try adding sundried tomatoes next time!  Follow the rest of the recipe as is, using real bacon (crumbled) - maybe more!  I baked it at 350 as recommended by other reviewers.  Next time I'll try serving over bowtie pasta.  Another reviewer suggested Harvest Cheddar Biscuits wiith this - GREAT suggestion, and great biscuits!

country:
None
text:
Delicious!  I've made this one a couple of times and since have made a couple of modifications based on previous recommenations: 1) use fresh spinach, 2) wilt spinach and mushrooms in bacon grease (I blotted the grease off before putting it in the pan so it wasn't too greasy), 3) do not cook the chicken before baking the dish, 4) I breaded the chicken breasts with Italian Panko crumbs instead of cubing the chicken.  For assembly I placed the mushrooms and spinach on the bottom, poured the sauce mixture over, then placed the chicken breast over all of that, and lastly sprinkled the cheese around the breasts.  Perfect dish, everyone loved it!

text:
This was hearty and delicious! I went about cooking it a different way. I melted the butter with some minced garlic then added cubed chicken. I sprinkled salts, pepper, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, thyme, and a little Cayenne to add a special after kick! After the meat was done I added a chopped up Portobello mushroom and and 1 bag of chopped babyshpinach. Tossed spinach and mushrooms around with the chicken coating all of it in the juices. I then added the remaining ingredients plus about a half a box of cooked broken pasta. Stirred it all together, pored it in a dish, added cheese to top and baked until golden brown...AWESOME!! Definitely making it again!

text:
This dish was so yummy and so easy to make.  Family loved it!  I did make several changes like other comments just to make recipe easier and use what I had in the fridge.  I did not use uncooked chicken (skipped step 1) I used 1 pound of frozen precooked fajita chicken strips.  So easy!!!  Used 9x13 dish.  Put 5 oz container of fresh baby spinach on bottom, then big container of fresh precut mushrooms on that,  the put frozen chicken strips on top of that, then poured mixture over entire dish.  Topped with mozzarella cheese and cut up pre-cooked bacon strips instead of bacon bits.  In the mixture I only had fat free cream of chicken soup and fat free half & half.  Was so terrific!!  Spinach looked like alot in beginning but cooked down to barely anything.  Also, I did not have italian seasoning on hand so I did not add any.  Would make this again anytime!!!!!

userID:
4352285
Display Name:
lizzielou
isPro:
False
followersCount:
3
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
43
favoritesCount:
1260
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/54.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Delish!  I made a few changes in order to use fewer pots/pans.  First I sauteed fresh mushrooms, onion, fresh minced garlic in Smart Balance and in the last few minutes I added thawed and drained frozen spinach.  I put all of that in the bottom of a sprayed 9x13 glass pan.  Next I sauteed chicken breasts cut in strips - can use chicken tenders - in the same pan with some Smart Balance just enough to get a golden color but not fully cook the chicken.  Placed the chicken on top of the spinach mix.  Then I made the sauce in the same skillet starting with a splash of white cooking wine and lemon juice, added mushroom soup and 1/2 can of half and half, Italian seasoning, Parmesan cheese, sea salt and black pepper and stirred and simmered to scrape up the pan drippings into the sauce.  Poured the sauce over the chicken, topped with crumbled bacon (microwaved while making sauce) and baked 20 min @ 350.  Added mozzarella and baked 5 min more.  Served with tossed salad and warm asiago cheese bread.  Husband and our 3 teens all loved it.  Thanks Bryan!

text:
My husband, as well as my 3,5 & 7 year old enjoyed this dish. I followed the advice of others and used fresh spinach, and mushrooms sauteed with minced garlic. I also used uncooked chicken to speed up the process. Unfortunately, I ended up having to cook the casserole for 20 more minutes anyway and had a watery dish from the chicken juices.  I would make this again, still using sauteed fresh veggies but i'd precook the chicken while preparing everything else. The sauce adds plenty of moisture to the meat. I would buy a fresh cut of Parmesian and hand grate it. The grated Parm for topping pizza is way too salty.
@ BRYANO320: great recipe, Thanks for adding it. :)

I loved this- very different, I thought, for a casserole. And low carb! I pretty much followed the recipe and the majority of the commenters. I cut up the chicken and browned it, I also sauteed the mushrooms and garlic for a bit before adding some wine, then the drained spinach. I mixed everything cold (sub. 2% milk for cream) and put it on top and it worked out great! I also crisped up some prosciutto for the bacon- yum! Personally, I think I'd like to double the spinach and maybe more of the sauce to make it more like a creamed spinach on the bottom. Can't wait to try it again soon!

Display Name:
Heather Calhoun

city:

country:
None
text:
I prepared it as many other suggested:  sauteed fresh spinach and fresh mushrooms (I used olive oil), spread out spinach and mushroom mixture in casserole dish, topped with uncooked chicken (I diced the chicken into bite sized pieces), then poured the sauce over everything, topped it with bacon (I fried my own), and baked for 25-30 minutes.  I took it out, topped it with a combination of mozzerella cheese and parmesan cheese (I didn't have a full cup of mozzerella on hand) and put it back in the oven for another 10 minutes.  This dish was good but I did add small amounts of seasoning salt to the spinach and mushrooms while cooking them, as well as to the raw chicken after I diced it up.  This recipe didn't call for any salt at all which was hard for me to believe.  This dish turned out good with the addition of a little salt.  I guess with the cream of mushroom soup (which can be salty depending on what else you use with it), cheeses and bacon, it doesn't seem like it should need any salt.  I am not a salt person but do like seasoned food.  Overall, this was a good dish.  The sauce was very good and I served this dish with a side of angel hair Pasta Roni.  I would definitely make this again and would probably add a little cayenne pepper or something else spicy to the sauce mixture.

Display Name:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The overall idea of this recipe was excellent and my family will eat it.  Hooorrayy!!  I made some changes to make it healthier for my family.  I also incorporated suggestions from other reviewers.  I lightly browned chicken in some olive oil for a couple of minutes.  Removed the chicken to a plate; added 3t garlic, 1/4 onion & mushrooms to chicken pan to saute in chicken juices until onion was translucent.  Added a bag of fresh spinach to the pan and cooked until just wilted.  In a separate bowl I combined skim milk, parm. cheese & Campbells heart healthy cream of mushroom soup.  Then I mixed sauce into spinach.  I layered a little sauce in the bottom of an 8x8 pan, placed chicken on top and then poured the rest of the spinach sauce on top.  I sprinkled approx 1/3 cup of bacon bits and 1 Cup of Mozzarellla cheese on top.  Baked at 400 for approx 40 minutes.  Personally, I use a meat thermometer and removed from oven when it reached 165 degrees.  I had to lightly cover with foil the last 10 minutes to keep cheese from over-browning.  I accidentally left out the italian seasoning and purposefully left out the lemon juice.  It was a GREAT dinner!  Thank you!

text:
Thanks for a great base recipe!  I pre-cooked the chicken breasts as recommended. Then I drained the spinach and sauteed in olive oil with garlic and red pepper flakes (no mushrooms, hubby's not a fan). For the sauce I used milk instead of half and half, and I increased the milk to a full cup. I used juice of half a lemon instead of 1 Tbl. I also melted 1/2 cup mozz cheese right into the sauce. Everything else for the sauce I went by the recipe. I used leftover rice pilaf (about a cup and a half) as the bottom layer in a 9 x 12 pan, topped with the spinach, then half the sauce, then the cut up chicken breasts, and the rest of the sauce. Baked for 20 minutes at 400, topped with bacon and 1 1/2 c mozz, baked for 20 min more. Delish. Next time I'd nix the bacon, it didn't add much flavor and I didn't love the crunchy texture. Great recipe!

This was so good and so easy.  I used a bag of fresh spinach since I didn't even know there was such a thing as canned spinach (eww) and I was in a hurry and didn't want to defrost the frozen type.  I used a can of cream of chicken and mushroom rather than plain mushroom.  I may try the  mushroom next time  just to see the difference in taste.  I did as another reviewer suggested and didn't cook the chicken first and saw no problem with that but I did increase the cooking time to 40 mins.  For the cheese I used a big of shredded cheese that had a mix of about 5 different cheeses.  Next time might cut chicken into bite sized pieces first and then I could reduce cooking time a little and will definitely make rice to serve it on.  Lots of yummy sauce!  Because of the time crunch I also just sprinkled 2-3 tbsp. of Bacos and it was fine.  Another plus....my picky 18 yr old daughter thought it was really good....she rarely says that.

text:
I made this using the changes suggested by others.  I did not precook the chicken, I cut down on the Italian seasoning (only 1 teaspoon), used frozen spinach instead of canned, used milk instead of cream, and used real bacon.  It smelled delicious, and the taste was quite nice, but...  This was far too rich and fatty for us.  The 1/4 cup of butter in the sauce makes it very greasy.  It was also too soupy and we found the garlic to be overpowering.  If you have issues with fatty foods or rich foods, stay away from this one!  My poor husband was up in the bathroom during the night.  I also ended up with a "rich" feeling in my stomach.   I really wanted to love this one, especially given the rave reviews.  Unfortunately, it just wasn't right for us.

I made this for Father's Day and everyone raved at how different and tasty it was.  The only diffence is I doubled all ingredients except I used 3 cans of spinach instead of 4 and used 1 cream of mushroom soup and 1 cream of chicken soup.  I used baby bella mushrooms, cooking them and the spinach in light butter before spreading in a lasagna pan.  I also lightly cooked the chicken in some olive oil before placing on the spinach layer. Cooked at 350 for 30 minutes topped with 1.5 cups mozzerella cheese, then added the other .5 cup for the last 10 minutes.  Served over white rice with a salad and italian bread, this recipe makes a truly delicious meal!  Thanks.

text:
Great recipe! About the canned vs. fresh spinach... its not so much that the canned spinach ruins the recipe, as much as it is simply a different flavor.  Canned spinach has a very distinct flavor and if you like it okay, then you will like it in this recipe just fine.  Clearly, fresh spinach is not, um... canned tasting, and therefore much more flavorful.  However, if all you have is canned, or frozen for that matter, and you don't mind the taste, then it will taste just fine.

text:
This was very good- I tweaked it a bit, to suit our tastebuds. 1) Used 2 10 pkgs. of cooked roasted chicken breast strips. 2) Sauteed the mushrooms & garlic in the butter, than added soups. One each cr. of mushroom & cr. of chicken. 3) Stirred in 2 tsp. Italian seasoning, the parmesan, and 1 Tbsp. lemon juice. 4) Added the parmesan, chicken, and about 2/3 of a pint of half & half. Tastes as I went, which was KEY! 5) Placed a layer of thawed frozen spinach into 9x13 dish. Poured the chicken/soup mixture over spinach. 6) Topped with 1 bag of real bacon pieces and then 8 oz. shredded mozzarella. 7) Covered, baked 30 mins, then 10 mins. more uncovered. I served fresh fettucini on the side, and it was a hit!! Thanks for a great recipe!

I made this dish for dinner and I thought it was pretty good.  I read the other reviews and decided to reduce the salt by buying low soduim bacon.  The flavor was good, but if I made it again I would definately use fresh spinach or reduce the amount of canned spinach. Two 13.5 oz cans is a lot of greenery for a 9x9" baking dish.  I would also increase the amount of sauce (by adding a little homemade white sauce--not more canned soup) so it could be served over noodles or rice without adding to the salt content. I would also sautee the mushrooms a smidgen--or slice them a bit thinner.

text:
Awesome, when you modify based on previous comments. I sautee the spinach, mushrooms and garlic and place it at the bottom of the dish. Then I layer half the mozzarella over that. Cubed, uncooked chicken goes over that. Then sauce layer - I use skim milk instead of half & half and it's fine. Bake 25 min at 350. Then the rest of the mozzarella on top for 10 min. I usually serve with buttered noodles.

userID:
8662480
Display Name:
judy2304
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/871418.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I was so looking forward to making this dish for my family. I made only a couple of changes that I think made it a little better than it would have been. I sautéed the chicken only long enough to brown it, and baked with everything else for 25 minutes, and then 10 minutes after the mozzarella was added. I used a bag of fresh spinach because I don't like any canned vegetables, and used milk instead of half and half. Other than these modifications, I followed the rest of the ingredients list to the letter. 

I may try this recipe again. I will make some of the suggested changes from other reviewers, and make some of my own. I will stay with using milk instead of half and half. The sauce was plenty rich with milk. The chicken was moist and tender. So I would do that the same and also use fresh or frozen spinach instead of canned. The amount of bacon bits was far too much. They made the dish much too salty. Next time, I will use crumbled real bacon or leave out the bacon all together. I think I would also reduce the amount of Parmesan cheese to 1/3 cup. Flavors in a sauce should blend and compliment, and I could single out the Parmesan cheese. I would also greatly reduce the amount of mozzarella cheese. The recipe calls for 2 cups. I used one cup and it was still way too much. I love mozzarella cheese, but this was overpowering. 

Neither my husband or I could eat this. We scraped off the chicken and picked out the spinach. This recipe has possibilities, but not as written.

text:
I thought this recipe looked good and knew instantly that I'd need to make a few tweaks (i just don't do bacon bits).  Here is what i changed: 
1. low fat cream of mushroom
2. 1/2 cup of 1% organic milk (half n half is just too rich)
3. 2 bags of fresh spinach (i sauteed them in batches.  I just prefer fresh to canned)
4. 8 oz of fresh mushrooms (i also sauteed these before putting them in the dish)
5. 4 slices of bacon instead of the bacon bits
6. 1 cup of mozzarella cheese

Also, instead of pre baking the chicken breasts I sauteed them per others suggestions in the comments.  My dad and I agreed (i brought him some leftovers) that I should reduce the garlic (maybe 1 tsp of fresh minced garlic instead of 3).

text:
I get so many compliments when I make this.  I modify it slightly, but you really don't have to.  I usually use left over fried chicken breast that I cube.  I fry up around 5 strips of bacon, and then make the sauce with the bacon grease adding maybe a tbs of butter instead of a 1/4 cup.  Some cream cheese goes into that because at this point we're not counting calories :)  Instead of parmesan I just use one of those bags of shredded italian cheese for both the sauce and topping.  One box of frozen spinach is all I add, and I omit the mushrooms (I'm the only one who eats them).  No layering, just mix it all together.  Eat, run 5 miles, then have a heart attack.  Totally worth it!

text:
The flavor and taste that this recipe produces is very good, but my biggest complaint is that I don't know what the meal is supposed to be. If it's a casserole, it should have a starch in it (rice) and preferably some more vegetables. Without the starch, it's not uniform like a typical casserole dish--it's just chicken in a very liquidy sauce (albiet tasty). If it's just a regular chicken dish with a nice sauce, it should just be cooked in a pan on the stovetop. My cooking level is definitely a beginner, so maybe everyone else knew what to expect. I just expected a casserole due to the title of the dish.

text:
Yuck! This was not to my liking at all. To quote my husband's comment, "If a recipe calls for canned spinach, move on to the next one." I couldn't agree more and wish I would have taken that into consideration BEFORE making this. I think fresh or frozen (chopped) spinach would be a MUCH better choice, but didn't substitute it for two reasons - I like to avoid making unnecessary changes to a recipe the first go around and (BIG reason) because so many reviews raved about how good this was (anyone who can rave about canned spinach wins my vote). To be fair, I did make one needed change (at least I think so...). Instead of baking my chicken first, I just layered it in my casserole dish and baked at 350 for 35 minutes. I feared my chicken would dry out otherwise. This is the first time in a LONG while that my husband and I didn't eat more than one bite of our dinner. We made a meal out of the Parmesan noodles and garlic bread I served on the side: :( Maybe this will float your boat, but it certainly didn't ours. Thanks anyways, Bryan! :-)

userID:
4262710
Display Name:
Swissschooner
isPro:

4

3
favoritesCount:
1096
recipesCount:

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/521021.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is a spin of a recipe called Chicken a la Maria from Better Homes & Gardens (1980s).  Four boneless chicken breasts, dredge in flour.  Then into Italian bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese.  Place in oven pan. Omit cream of mushroom soup (and if you must have mushrooms, use fresh and saute as below with green onions), make your own Bechamel sauce: In pan melt 3 Tablespoons butter add  one bunch chopped green onions, the when lightly browned add 1/4 cup chopped ham.  Add 3 Tablespoons flour, brown well.  Add 1 cup apprx.(i use skim!) milk and stir 'till thickened to your liking. Add 1 box (thawed) frozen spinach.  Top with 1/4 cup Parmesan and four pats butter.  Google Chicken a la Maria for exact recipe - it is PERFECT! But please see:  http://www.cooks.com/rec/view/0,1639,157183-234199,00.html

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/437108.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I basically used this recipe for the sauce because I didn't have spinach or mozzarella cheese. I used diluted gluten-free creamy mushroom soup, which I thickened by adding cornstarch to the milk before stirring it in. I also took another reviewer's suggestion and fried up some bacon, cut up the chicken, and cooked it in the bacon fat. I served the creamy chicken mixture over brown rice topped with crumbled bacon and it was fantastic. My only complaint is there was a bit too much Italian seasoning for my liking, and I only used two teaspoons.

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I made this for supper last night and I have to say it's Wonderful! I did make a few changes. 1)I cut the chicken into bite size pieces, cooked that on the stove with some olive oil and the mushrooms. 2) After the chicken was no longer pink I added the rest of the ingredients but only 1 cup of mozz. cheese, and I used 1% milk, cooked until all was bubbly. 3) poured it all into the dish on top of the spinach (used frozen spinach and it was fine) topped off with the last cup of mozz. cheese and spinkled with Parmasean cheese. Put it in the oven at 400 for 25 mintues.I served it Al Dente spinach fettuccine noodles.

userID:
5809884
Display Name:
Shelby Field
isPro:

0

17

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5054893.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe was SO GOOD! My husband and I do not like mushrooms at all but I decided to try them in this recipe anyways. We both loved it, we did pick around the mushrooms but they gave it great flavor!! I did make some revisions.
1) cut the chicken into cubes and cook with EVOO and the minced garlic and 1/2 of the italian seasoning, until the outside is white.
2) After the chicken is white on the outside, add the soup (I used cream of chicken & mushroom mix), half-and-half (or milk), lemon juice, 1/2 of the italian seasoning,  and 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese.
3)Start to boil 1 box of noodles of your choice.
4)I used a bag of frozen spinach and put that on the bottom of my baking dish (used 9x13 instead). Then covered with a thin layer of mushrooms. and Added the chicken mix. On top I crumbled real bacon, added the rest of the mozzarella cheese, and sprinkled parmesan on the top.
5) Bake for 20 min. the last 6-8 I put in garlic bread.
6)For presentation I put noodles on the bottom of a round platter with curved edges. Added the chicken florentine bake on top. Then put the garlic bread on the edges.

text:
This is a good recipe; I made a few changes.  As someone else suggested, I also chopped the chicken into cubes and cooked it in a pan instead of baking it in the oven.  Also, I felt the canned spinach gave the dish a funny taste, so I would suggest using fresh baby spinach leaves instead.  They can be quickly stir fried on the stove beforehand to make them soft.  But this was still a really good dish and my friends really enjoyed it!

Delicious use of leftover chicken and surprisingly not "cream soup"-like! Sautéed fresh spinach, mushrooms and garlic in a little butter and olive oil; laid in bottom of casserole dish. Made sauce in same sauté pan. Layered sauce over spinach mixture, then cut up chicken, and rest of sauce. Bacon and half of mozzarella cheese. 350 for 25 min covered; added rest of cheese, 10 min uncovered. Served over pasta.

This recipe is a keeper.  My family enjoyed it.  I followed the recipe with only minor changes.  I used two bags of fresh spinach and 2% milk instead of half and half.  I took the advice of another reviewer and cut the chicken into bite size pieces and sauted in bacon drippings.  I added the spinach and the other ingredients and cooked on low for 10 minutes.  I poured the mixture into a pan. Sprinkled with bacon bits and cheese and baked for 25 minutes. I served on top of our favorite pasta with parmesan sprinkled on top.

I served this to my family and a friend. We all really enjoyed it. This recipe sounds wonderful as is; however, like others, I added my own twists. 1) Diced and cooked chicken on stove, being careful not to overcook it. 2) I combined the mushrooms with the sauce. 3) I boiled penne pasta al dente and used the pasta as the bottom layer. 4) Added freshly ground pepper. This is a great recipe. Thank you so much for sharing! It's now a family favorite!

text:
This was very tasty!  I did a couple things differently...first, I  marinated the chicken pieces in an Italian dressing for about an hour and then I pan fried them until nearly done.  I figured as long as I would be baking the chicken, it didn't have to be well done before I added it to the casserole.  I sliced the chicken pieces after removing from the skillet. I used the same pan that I sauteed the chicken to saute the garlic and then added the soup, a half can of Half & Half (about a cup), about a cup of finely grated parmesan (hand grated) and a 6 oz. jar of mushrooms, drained.  I also used a bag of frozen spinach, thawed and squeezed dry.  Followed the directions after that....This made a nice amount of sauce to place on penne pasta.  My husband loved it!!!!

region:

country:
None
text:
I didn't give five stars because mine was so darn good and I believe that was due to the fresh spinach used and not pre cooking the chicken. I used a whole bag of fresh baby spinach and stirred it on stove top with fresh minced garlic and 8oz. of baby portabella mushrooms in the melted butter. Just cooked it enough to basically wet the spinach and condense it just a bit. Then put that on the bottom of a 9X13 pan, placed 5 uncooked chicken breast on top, poured the sauce over that and had more parm cheese than stated mixed in that also. I didn't have bacon bits and it was great without them. Everyone in my family said this is a keeper...and it was so easy to make....they did all say it needed more spinach so next time a bag and a half.  I baked at at 350 for about 55-60 min. until chicken temp was at 160.

I agree with other reviewers that this was pretty salty, even for a salt lover like me.  I believe the extremely salty flavor was coming from the bacon bits so, if you have time maybe frying your own bacon would help to reduce the strong salty flavor...?  I chopped my chicken and cooked it in olive oil in the skillet and then followed the recipe as directed.  I served over bow tie pasta as I thought this would be more attractive to my children.  I was right however; they weren't interested in "green stuff" (spinach) in this dish.   Overall, this was pretty good.

text:
This recipe is very DELICIOUS..... this is the first time that i've ever had chicken florentine, and i must say that it is very impressive. I followed someo f the suggestions. I sauteed fresh spinach, garlic, and mushroom in butter, and added a splash of white wine... I put that mixture on the bottom of the baking pan. After I cooked and crumbled the bacon, I browned the chicken in the bacon grease. I cooked it in the oven at 350 for about 20 minutes, then i took it out, put on the layer of mozzarella and cooked it until it turned golden brown, another 10 minutes. Very delicious and the boys definitely loved it. I served it over pasta with garlic bread. I will definitely put this recipe into my recipe collection.

Made this as written and it was really good, but being my lazy self,the second time I made it with leftover chicken. First cooked chopped bacon in the skillet, then sauteed onion and then cubed chicken in bacon fat, added in the spinach and shrooms to wilt. Stirred in the remaining ingredients and served over hot cooked noodles. I t was really quick and easy and a really delicious way to use up leftover chicken!

text:
Holy cow was this scrumpdillyicious!!!!  Easily a restaurant quality meal!  I read many reviews and only made minor tweaks, but not changing the ingredients.  I did the chicken breasts in a skillet and set aside.  I then melted the butter and sauteed the spinach (one bag of fresh spinach, you could use more), mushrooms, garlic and just enough onion to taste.  I didn't have italian seasoning so I improvised and used parsley, basil and oregano.  As suggested, I only used about a teaspoon of the lemon juice.  I served it over spaghetti.  This is a keeper and will be kept in our rotation!

I thought this was just delicious- reminded me of eating in a great restaurant- full of flavor.  I'm a big garlic fan so I minced up about 4 big cloves.  I also added chopped marinated artichokes.  I left out the bacon and didn't feel I was missing anything.  I put it over linguinie so my only regret was that I didn't make more of the delicious sauce, (though it definitely coated at least half a pound and I wouldn't add much more pasta then that anyway as to not take away from the casserole)!! For all vegetarians- if you leave out the chicken and the bacon, it's a great sauce for pasta!  Thank you!!

This is a great recipe but there are a few things you need to do differently. 1. cut chicken into bite sizes and cook in the bacon grease. 2. I used 1 bag of fresh spinach and cooked it in the bacon and chicken grease with the mushrooms. 3. I used 1 cup mozzarella cheese in sauce and another cup on top ten min. before removing from the oven. I kept the casserole covered and removed it the last ten min. I also used milk instead of the half and half.

text:
Wonderful!  I did my sauce a little differently.  I sauted the garlic, butter and mushrooms together, then added my spices and used 1/2 can of cream of mushroom soup and 1/2 can of cream of chicken with herbs.  Added the parm. cheese.  Used milk instead of cream. Left out the lemon juice and bacon because I didn't have on hand.  I didn't use as much butter, only about a tbsp.  I wanted to serve the dish  with pasta and have everything in one casserole, so I put a layer of angel hair pasta on the bottom of my casserole dish.  Next I put a layer of sauce. Layer of spinach, cubed chicken seasoned with salt and pepper (I just put mine in raw) and finally the rest of the sauce.  Topped with some grated mozzerella cheese. Baked it in the oven at 375 for 30 -40 minutes.  Turned out delicious!

text:
This was delicious!  I followed the advice of other reviewers and cut the chicken into strips.  I cooked the spinach and mushrooms in a little butter and garlic, then cooked the chicken in a little butter.  Put them in the dish.  Then, I combined all the ingredients for the sauce (with slightly less butter and garlic since I had used up some in previous steps).  The creamy sauce does not need to be added in layers.  Pouring it on top is fine.  It works it's way down while baking.  I did substitute half the half n half for skim milk to cut some calories, and it was still perfect!  Highly recommend this!

I made this for my husband who is on a low carb diet.  We both loved it!  I did modify it somewhat based on what I had on hand at the time.  I cooked onion and garlic, then added the ingredients to make the sauce, used a whole bag of fresh spinach, shredded rotisserie chicken, added some uncooked broccoli and used shredded pepperoni as I didn't have any bacon, combined it all together in a 9x13 casserole dish and sprinkled the top with grated mozzarella cheese and baked. userID:

Display Name:
Marisa R.
isPro:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Ok, even my vegetable-loathing son loved this! He actually ate 2 helpings! That may not mean much to you, but for me, just plain amazing.  I took the advice of others and saute`d the spinach and mushrooms together with just a little garlic and put it on the bottom.  Then I just took some raw chicken tenders and chopped them into bite size pieces and placed them on top of the spinach, then topped with the sauce... Baked at 350 for 20-25 minutes, then topped with mozzarella and bumped up the heat to 400 for another 10 minutes.  I also used a 16 oz. bag of chopped spinach, well drained, instead of the canned because I find canned spinach to be mushy and was afraid it would turn everyone off by its appearance.  Served on top of thin spaghetti seasoned with a little butter, fresh parsley, garlic and pepper... Way easy and Definately a Yum-O dish!

userID:
3340824
Display Name:
Christina Delia
isPro:
False
followersCount:
12
followingCount:

4

reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2956051.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is a great one dish meal made with the pasta.  I'd also recommend this for one of those evenings when the extended family is in town, as it could easily be made ahead.  I save my 5 stars for gourmet meals that are beyond compare, and it's not one of those, but it's hearty.  

I made several modifications to this recipe based on previous feedback.  First, I used raw chicken pieces (about four pieces per breast).  Second, I sauteed raw spinach along with the mushrooms in EVOO along with a teaspoon of the garlic.  The recipe calls for canned spinach and I cannot possibly think of any green vegetable packed in a can that has ever tasted good and with as easy as it is to wilt fresh spinach, I didn't consider frozen either.  

I used cooked pasta as my first layer, followed by the spinach/mushroom saute, and then the raw chicken pieces.  I then placed the raw chicken atop the saute and covered the layers with the sauce followed by the Mozz Cheese.  FYI, when including the pasta in the dish, you'll need more sauce, so I doubled the recipe, with the exception of the Italian Seasonings.  
I then cooked the entire dish at 400 for 50 minutes.  PERFECT!!

The chicken was moist and the sauce was perfectly flavored.

text:
Ok first off, I changed quite a bit. Forgot to say Hubby does not eat chicken so I substituted shrimp in place of chicken and doubled the sauce part of the recipe because I wanted to serve it as sauce over linguini.  Excellent flavor. Relatively easy to prepare. Not terrible expensive and made with ingredients you may already have on hand. I used fresh baby spinach (a pretty good layer of it on the bottom of the casserole dish), topped it with fresh mushrooms then the cooked shrimp. Poured the doubled batch of sauce ingredients over the top. I also added a small minced onion to the sauce ingredients. I used Progresso Mushroom Soup because I find we like the flavor better however it is ready to serve and not condensed like Campbell's so I withheld some of the Half and Half (fat free). I used only half the butter too. I realize that I changed a lot but that seems to be the way I cook, sorry (I hate it when people do that ;). I truly think it would still be great even if I hadn't. Thanks for the great recipe BRYAN0320

text:
This dish is amazing! Based on the numerous review I read, I made it like this: Sauteed the chicken breasts in olive oil and garlic. Once done, I chopped into cubes. The biggest improvisation I had to make was when I discovered I had no cream of mushroom soup! I found the "Cream of Mushroom Soup I" on this site and made 1/5 of it. It came out terrific! Talk about a rush, trying to imitate C of M soup. :) Right before baking, I mixed everything together in one pan, and topped with real bacon bits and more cheese. Served with a wee bit of pasta to go beneath. Next time, I'll just mix cooked pasta right in for that all-in-one-pan convenience. Thanks for the recipe!

Had to give this 5 stars as it was so good. I did make a few small changes though. It doesn't have to be that fattening either. I first marinated my chicken in the olive oil, garlic and italian seasonings. Chicken is too bland without it. Then, prepared recipe as written except I cut my chicken into strips - easier to marinate - and used less cream, some light milk and chicken stock to keep the sauce creamy. Also used SmartBalance butter and less of it. Fabulous meal and a keeper!

text:
I give this 4 stars but my husband gave it 5 and even asked for the recipe to make for the guys at the firehouse. I personally did find it a little on the saltier side. That might be eliminated by using real bacon though. 
I did follow the directions, but I used 2 10 oz pkgs frozen spinach instead of canned, I used milk instead of half &half, and for the italian seasoning I used the good seasonings italian blend for salad dressing. All in all it was a good dinner and I will probably make it again. It was also pretty easy to make. I made the sauce while the chicken was cooking and started to arrange the spinach mushrooms( you really could use a 8oz sliced mushrooms and it would be fine) and sauce  in the 9x13. It was great as leftovers for lunch the next day too!

Display Name:
J. Mtz.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/1747.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Like the others, I loved this recipe, but with a couple of changes that I did from the suggestions.  I browned the chicken in a skillet with some olive oil and cut it up into bite-sized pieces.  I also layered rotini pasta in the bottom of the casserole dish. The  substitutions I made were Healthy Request cream of mushroom soup, skim milk instead of half and half, fresh baby spinach instead of canned, packaged crumbled bacon instead of bacon bits, and 2% mozzarella cheese.  I also used a whisk when making the sauce in the pan; it makes it much smoother and helps with the pouring.  Everything else I followed according to the recipe.  With these changes, the recipe was fantastic.  The leftovers tasted even better the next day.  Thanks for a great recipe!

city:

country:
None
text:
Made this tonight and it was very good. Like others, I sauteed the chicken in a pan with some olive oil (and sprinkled some salt and pepper and Italian seasoning on it) instead of baking it. I did make a few additional changes which included putting a little less mozzarella and parmesan, useing healthy request soup, and using skim milk in place of the half and half. I also used chopped prosciutto instead of bacon, since that is what I had on hand, but honestly I think it complements the dish  more than bacon would anyway. I covered the casserole with aluminum foil and removed the foil for the last 5 minutes so the cheese would get some color but so it was still melty and not as much of a "skin." Served it over egg noodles. Hubby asked me to add this to the monthly rotation.

text:
This is truly one of the best dishes I have made from this site. My family loved it!  I took the advice of some of the others and sauteed the chicken in olive oil, garlic, and seasoned salt instead of pre-cooking it in the oven.  Also, my family is not a fan of mushrooms, so I replaced the mushrooms will onions.  I sauteed the onions briefly while I wilted the fresh spinach.  It was perfect!  Lastly, I used fat free half & half to eliminate some of the fat and real bacon instead of bacon bits.  I won't change a thing when I cook this again! Thanks for this wonderful family favorite!

text:
This was quick and easy comfort food.  The sauce was incredible.  I followed other reveiwers advice and cut up and pan fried my chicken with a little EVOO and garlic.  Mixed everything together and put it in a 9x9 dish.  I used fat free cream of mushroom soup, fat free half and half, fresh spinach (I think next time I will chop it up) and reduced fat mozzarella cheese.  I didn't have any bacon, but we didn't miss it.  I was also very short on the amount of Pamesan cheese, so I used about 1/4 cup of 4 italian cheese mix.  Served this over angel hair spag, sprinkled with fresh parmesan cheese!  Thanks, this will get put on the regular menu at our house!
