userID:
4819405
Display Name:
Suzy-Q
isPro:
False
followersCount:
1
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
35
favoritesCount:
108
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614256.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe is easily streamlined and based on a few other reviews, I did the following:  Cut raw chicken breasts into 1" cubes. In a twelve" skillet sauteed real bacon until crisp, then removed and set aside,  keeping about 1 tbsp of bacon grease in skillet.  Added 1 drained 4 oz can of mushroom stems and pieces to skillet, along with 1 bag of fresh baby spinach, sauteed until spinach has wilted. poured that into baking dish, (I never, ever buy canned spinach).  In same skillet, made sauce almost as directed. I personally thought it was too thick so added half to 3/4 soup can of water to sauce and whisked together. Poured half that over spinach, then topped with raw chicken cubes, rest of sauce and then topped that with crumbled bacon. I did not use the mozzarella cheese (I didn't have any) and am glad I didn't.  I agree with another reviewer who said the sauce was very rich  even though I thinned it and left off the mozzarella, it was still rich, but good.  Baked at 350 for 40 minutes, and served over linguini.

text:
Don't hesitate to try this! This was one of the best meals I've gotten from Allrecipes over the years. We loved it! I followed the advice from the very first review and sautéed a bag of fresh spinach with a little butter, garlic and mushrooms. Put that in the bottom of my casserole dish, placed the raw chicken on top and topped with the sauce and baked. Took out for the last 10 minutes and topped with mozzarella cheese. I had to bake mine longer than stated, but my oven temp is off on the low side. Kept baking until thermometer read 165 degrees and the chicken was moist and tender! If you use fresh spinach, I would recommend doubling the amount bc after sautéing it wilts down to almost nothing.

This was delicious, but I found it a little too salty to give it 5 stars. I did make some changes as suggested by another user: fried 4 pcs of bacon then cooked the (cubed) chicken and garlic in the bacon grease. Removed that then cooked a bag of fresh baby spinach and mushrooms in same pan. I used 1/4 cup 2% milk and 1/4 cup half & half. I put one cup of the mozz in the sauce. I mixed half the chicken in the sauce and put the other half on top of the spinach/mushroom mixture. Baked at 350 for 30 min in covered casserole dish. Uncovered and sprinkled remaining cheese on top and cooked additional 10 minutes. Served over thin spaghetti.

text:
I would make this again with a few tweaks as other users have suggested. While I love rich dishes, this dish was overly rich. Next time I may sub milk for the half and half and use slightly less cheese and bacon. I also did not pre-cook my chicken but put the raw chicken in the casserole dish with the sauce on top of the veggies and cooked at 350 for 20 minutes. I then topped with the remaining cheese and bacon and finished it at 400 for 15 minutes. Definitely good if you're looking for a rich and decadent dish!

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674159.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
We really loved this casserole.  I followed the advice of another reviewer and skipped precooking the chicken to make this faster.  I didn't have bacon bits, so I fried up a couple of pieces of bacon and then diced them.  I only had fresh spinach (used the majority of a bag) and canned mushrooms on hand, so I sauted those both up in a little of  bacon grease and then put on the bottom of the dish.  Then I layered the raw chicken, sauce and bacon.  I left the cheese off until the last 10 minutes of cooking.  In the sauce, I cut the butter down to 1/8 cup and used 1/2 c skim milk to cut the calories a bit, but it was still plenty rich.  Another reviewed recommended cooking for 30 minutes at 350 and then adding cheese and cooking an additional 10 minutes, but our chicken was raw yet, so my husband put it in for another 30 minutes, but I think that was a little long.  I'm thinking about 50 minutes probably would have been ideal, but just check your chicken to make sure it is fully cooked.  The flavor was excellent over pasta.  I will definitely make again.

None
text:
I made this for company and put it together during the day and cooked it later.  I cooked bacon (not a fan of prepared bacon bits) and drained the grease.  I added a little oil and browned 1 side of the breasts then cooked the mushrooms and garlic in a little butter and then added a package of fresh spinach and wilted it.  I made the sauce and took the advice of someone else and added about a cup of cheese to the sauce.  Added the spinach, mushrooms and garlic to a casserole dish, topped with some sauce, added the breasts and poured the remainder of the sauce on top, then bacon pieces, and topped with about 1/2 cup cheese.  This was a big hit with everyone!

text:
This was quite good.  I made a few changes according to some of the other reviews.  Fresh spinach,  several slices of bacon, and cuting the chicken into chunks sauteing them in some bacon fat all worked for me.  I used fresh grated pamigiana cheese too.  With a splash of white wine this would make a nice company dish served on thin spaghetti.  My husband doesn't care at all for spinach, but he said the dish was real good and he didn't realize spinach was even in it (I don't know what he thought that green stuff was?)  It wasn't the ultimate recipe, but I will make it again one day.

text:
I pr-cooked chicken in oven with butter but a little dry.  I would sauteed in pan in butter and olive oil next time.  I sauteed 1/2 chopped onion and mushrooms and butter, olive oil and Italian seasoning added minced garlic and squeezed half a fresh lemon over it.  Then I added the cream and soup to that mixture and grated Parmesan cheese but just a 1/4 cup  I used fresh spinach and parboiled it to make enough for 2 cups. I layered spinach, then half cream sauce chopped chicken into bite size pieces layered them and then covered with the remaining cream sauce and grated mozzarella on top.  Baked at 375 degrees for 1/2 hour till bubbly.

text:
This is a good recipe my husband enjoys it. I do as other reviewers suggest and I skip the first part and I sautéed the mushroom and garlic in some butter and then sautéed fresh baby spinach until wilted. I have used frozen and thawed spinach as well before and it works too. I layer mushrooms and spinach on bottom, put raw chicken on top and pour prepared sauce on everything and top with bacon. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 then top with mozzarella and bake for 10 more minutes but I have add mozzarella before baking before and baked 30 and it turned out good. There is a lot of sauce and the water from the chicken can make it kinda runny so I think it would be good to use the sauce like a gravy for mash potatoes.

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674138.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I first made this recipe exactly as written, and it was good. I did notice, however, that in layering the spinach and mushrooms in the pan, I would get random huge bites of spinach, and then none in other bites.  I would have given the dish 3 stars then.  After reading reviews from others, it's not the ingredients I changed (aside from milk instead of half and half), but rather the way I put it together.  Everything up to step three I follow- then I simply add my spinach, bacon, and mushrooms to the sauce itself, stir it all together- place the chicken in my pan (do not brown it first, waste of time) and pour the sauce to coat.  Pop it in the oven for about 25 minutes and it comes out perfect!  Letting it set after pulling it out of the oven thickens the sauce a bit, and it's simply DELICIOUS.  I've made this recipe time and time again and it's one of my favorites on allrecipes!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I like it a lot, although like most other reviewers, I felt that the recipe itself was a start that could benefit from a lot of tweaking.  So forgive me for giving a review for a recipe that I modified heavily, without at least trying it as written the first time.  I usually don't do this.  My only addition to the many very worthwhile comments would be: 1. spend 5 more minutes to make a quick white sauce, then add your own mushrooms, using at least 8 oz. of fresh mushrooms (you can even add a touch of sherry); 2. use fresh or frozen spinach instead of canned.  We buy large bags of fresh spinach that we can never finish, so I freeze it and always have some available for cooking; 3. if you are concerned about saturated fat, you can substitute canned milk for the half and half without even noticing the difference--the other strong flavors will dominate, and the texture is controlled by the thickness of the rest of the sauce.  Try it once before you dismiss it.

I used the recipe right up to where it says canned spinach, I just couldnt do it. I used a bag of fresh spinach which I sauteed with the fresh mushrooms and garlic in a drizzle of olive oil. I put that in the bottom of the casserole dish and then followed the rest of the recipe. I found that 2C of mozzerella was too much for us, so I used 1C. I also used about 2 Tbsp white wine in place of the lemon juice. I added 1 Tbsp granulated garlic to the sauce along with the italian seasoning.I cut up some cooked leftover chicken breast and served everything over fettucini noodles. We loved it. Thanks for the great idea.

text:
It was amazing! I read some reviews before making it. I also used frozen spinach, which made it kinda soupy.. but still great. I fried the bacon and sauteed the mushrooms in the bacon grease, then put that on top of the spinach in a 9x13 pan, then cooked the chicken partially and put half the sauce on the spinach and then added the chicken and put the rest of the sauce on the chicken, topped it with the bacon pieces and the mozzarella cheese. Covered and baked at 350 for 20 mins, then uncovered and baked for another ten mins. I couldn't get the cheese to brown because of the water from the spinach but it would have been great over rice. I had two helpings... couldn't stop eating it!

userID:
2308854
Display Name:
F.Patel
isPro:

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/543353.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Even though I have not made this dish for a while, it has become one of my favorites. The first few time I actually measured each ingredient, now I just eyeball it. You must make it with all the recommendations of the other viewers. That is what I did and it was absolutely tasty!
You do not need to bake the chicken separately. What I did was: 
I sautéed some garlic and cooked my mushrooms and red peppers, and wilted my spinach in that mixture so it would get the flavor of the garlic. I arranged that in a casserole tray. I then sautéed some onions, more garlic and cooked the chicken. I left the chicken in the pot and made the sauce: with the herbs, soup, lemon juice, parmesan cheese, 2% milk, and salt and pepper.
 I then poured the sauce on top of the spinach mixture and let it cook in the oven for 15 minutes. I then added some mozzarella cheese and baked some more and served with white fluffy rice. YUM

text:
This was great, although my version was loosely similar to this one by the time I got done.  Having to just use what I had, I used green beans instead of spinach, 8 chicken breasts that I boiled and cubed, 3/4 tsp of garlic powder in place of garlic, a can of sausage gravy in place of the cream of mushroom soup, pizza seasoning instead of Italian seasoning, and milk and a dollop of sour cream in place of half-and-half.  It still worked out and was really good, so obviously, the recipe is fairly flexible!

text:
This was awesome!  and I'm not a big fan of recipes with cream soup.  I just did a few things differently so I'm really not altering the recipe just the method.  I placed fresh spinach in a 9x12 pan, arranged chicken tenders on top, mixed the sauce together as directed and poured over the chicken and spinach.  Last 5 mins topped with Mexican cheese because that's what I had on hand.  Didn't add bacon or mushrooms but most likely would make a great addition.  Easy method - just layer it in a casserole and bake at 400 for about 40/45 mins.

text:
4 stars only because I made a few changes to it.  This was soooo good though!  My changes were that I used skim milk instead of half & half and only used 1/4 cup.  Spinach has so much moisture anyway the sauce really didn't need that much milk.  I doubled the spinach (we LOVE spinach) and sauteed it with minced garlic and onions.  I also added parm cheese and red pepper flakes to the spinach mixture.  I also sauteed the chicken for 2 minutes on each side before adding it to the baking dish w/the spinach.  After the mozzerella melted I topped it with italian bread crumbs and broiled it until they were toasted.  I served it with pasta but it didn't need it!  It was AMAZING all by itself!

text:
Made this last night.  It was just ok.  1 T. of italian seasoning is way too much!  It was overwhelming.  2/3 C of bacon bits was too much too.  It made the dish too salty.  Next time I'd use a 1/2 tsp. of italian seasoning and just a scant sprinkling of bacon bits.  I'd also try using a little less butter in the sauce.  I put the uncooked chicken on the sauteed fresh spinach and cooked it, and it was very, very soupy, so I'd opt for stewing the chicken first, cutting it up and placing it on the spinach mixture. 1 C of mozzarella is enough.  2C would have been too much.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe was fantastic.  I made the following  changes.  I cut the chicken breasts into smaller pieces (they were pretty large and thick), coated them with a mixture of Panko and Italian breadcrumbs and browned them in a mixture of butter and olive oil (about 1 T each) for 2-3 minutes per side instead of cooking the whole breasts in the oven.  For the sauce mixture I started out with some diced onion and sauteed that for a few minutes prior to adding the garlic and the rest of the ingredients.  I used a bag of fresh baby spinach in place of the canned spinach (will use more fresh spinach next time).  Topped it with a mixture of mozzarella and provolone cheese that I had on hand - along with some peppered bacon (diced) that I also had in the refrigerator.  This is definitely company worthy!  My husband thoroughly enjoyed it and we are looking forward to having the leftovers.  This recipe is a keeper for sure!!

userID:
3881088
Display Name:
Pandora Spocks
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0

0
madeRecipesCount:
10
favoritesCount:
182
recipesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674163.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I really liked this recipe. My husband thought it was great! I did vary this up a bit, using most of the same ingredients, but in different amounts & prepared differently based on previous reviews. Things like less canned spinach, Italian seasoning, butter, lemon juice & mozzarella; sauteing the mushrooms & and chicken in a skillet; &  adding uncooked instant rice on top of the spinach layer to help with the "too liquidy" complaint while making this mor of an actual casserole. I also added a drained can of quartered artichoke hearts before pouring on the sauce & left out the bacon. The finished dish was very good with the changes, but I would do a few things differently next time to make it even better. First, I cut the chicken into 1" pieces, again to make this more of a casserole, but sauteing & then baking left them overcooked. Next time I will not pre-cook the chicken. Also, even though I basically doubled most of the other ingredients since I had more chicken & wanted to use a 9"x13" pan, I only used 1 tbsp of Italian seasoning & thought that was still too much. I will use a 1/2 tbsp next time. I also sprinkled some seasoned salt & pepper over the spinach layer since canned spinach is bland & there is no salt or pepper called for in the recipe. I will also increase the rice amount to 1 1/2 cups (up from 1 cup). The end result was delicious & something I am looking forward to making again. Thanks!

text:
This was WONDERFUL!!!! So flavorful & tasty! I wasn't sure we'd like it because me & my family don't love cooked spinach, but you couldn't even taste it, just gave it great texture & color!  I cut up the chicken, seasoned it & cooked it in a fry pan on the stove in some oil first. I finely chopped up frozen spinach (my family doesn't like big chunks of spinach) & put in casserole dish first. Then I layered the cooked chicken next. Then I mixed the sauce ingredients in the frying pan & poured over chicken & spinach. Then I grated mozzarella & sprinkled over that. Baked in oven at 350 for 30 minutes until bubbly. Smelled HEAVENLY!

userID:
5051826
Display Name:
Jennifer Christie
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:

madeRecipesCount:
5
favoritesCount:
232
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/489567.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I used leftover spinach and ricotta filling from lasagna for the base of this dish and added dried (reconstituted) shiitake mushrooms. Sauteed garlic and sliced onion and put that over the chicken breasts that I browned in the pan. To the sauce I added milk instead of half-and-half and crumbled bacon right into the sauce. I found the sauce quite salty; next time I will use reduced sodium soup. You certainly don't need to add additional salt because of the bacon and parmesan cheese. Topped the chicken breasts with sliced Gouda and baked at 350 for 20 minutes only. Came out perfect and tasty!

text:
My family enjoyed this casserole.  I doubled the ingredients and made it with the following changes. I cut the chicken into bite size pieces and lightly sauted. I fried a few slices of bacon, then fried the mushrooms and garlic in the bacon grease.  When browned I added 3 10 oz boxes of frozen chopped spinach (squeezed dry first) along with remaining ingredients and stirred over heat til warm.  I put 2 cups of the mozarella in casserole and 2 cups on top.  After baking I tossed with 1 lb of farfalle pasta.

Review:
Rating:
4
dateLastModified:
2010-08-09T12:32:55.433
helpfulCount:
1
userID:
5152477
Display Name:
kealohanui
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
1
favoritesCount:
14
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674134.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
My family loves this dish. I try to stay as close to the original recipe but it doesn't work out that way. Spouse went fishing and we have ahi (tuna) for a while, so when I made it with ahi, it turned out better than the other variations according to them. I use whatever ingredients are on hand. We grow spinach, sweet basil, green onions and lime which I used for the recipe. I started by searing ahi in olive oil, garlic and lime juice. Removed the ahi steak from pan and cut in cubes. I drained the drippings and placed in freezer for future use.  In separate skillet, I sauteed garlic, green onions in olive oil, lime juice and added a little basil. I didn't have cream of mushroom, so I made white sauce by cutting approximately 8oz fat free cream cheese into chunks and placed in skillet on lower heat, added approximately 1c whole milk so cheese would not burn. I whisked in Italian dressing mix I had in the cupboard. I was careful to skim the top ingredients in the bag, leaving the salt behind. I added dressing mix to taste and didn't use the whole bag. For that subtle kick, I added 1/2t Korean garlic chili paste (clear jar with green top and rooster on it). If cream sauce too thick, I added more lime juice.  Steamed spinach. I didn't have mushrooms, mozerella cheese and my family is not fan of bacon bits. I layered as suggested, topped with shredded parmesan and baked for 15minutes. Served with plain sourdough bread slices.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was a great starter recipe. With a little fine tweaking, I was able to make it a bit healthier. I used store bought rotisserie chicken & shredded it (breast meat only). Only change I made to the sauce was using cream of chicken instead of mushroom. I added steamed broccoli & julienne carrots & omitted the spinach, bacon & mushrooms (our preference) and used shredded skim mozzarella. I layered steamed veggies, then 1/2 the sauce, then chicken, then a second layer of each finishing with a light coating of the shredded cheese. Baked for approx 20-30 mins @ 350. It was delish. I made it for just my husband & I but our 3 boys & their girlfriends wiped most of it out. Next time I will make a double batch and may add steamed cauliflower. Served with a salad.

text:
I like this recipe...I will make it again!  If your looking for very low fat...without losing the richness...I used fat free half an half, and 98% fat free condensed soup. In my opinion the parmesean/mozzerella are not necessary, the other ingredients make the recipe.My other suggestion would be to brine chicken before cooking to hold in the juices/flavor.

text:
This was an excellent chicken dish. I doubled the recipe, and made few changes. I also used fresh spinich as other did. I added 1 onion which I sauteed & then added fresh spinich & cooked it till wilted. I used 2 bags & would probably add more next time, as I loved the flavor & another bag would not be over powering at all. I increased the mushrooms, using a combination of portabello & shitake. I didn't add italian seasoning, but did add a pinch of oregano & about a tsp. of basil, Tbs. of parsley, and pepper to taste.  I also cut up split chicken breasts, which I cooked on the outside only (pink inside).  I can't wait to make again. Just loved it.

text:
Excellent recipe.  I used a couple of cups of fresh spinach, which I sauted in a small amount of margarine before spreading across the bottom of my baking pan.  I used fat free half and half and 98% fat free cream of mushroom soup in an attempt to make this somewhat healthier.  I microwaved 4 strips of turkey bacon to create the bacon pieces.  I also had some leftover roasted chicken (from a previous night's dinner) I used in place of the chicken breasts.  I baked as directed and served over garden rotini pasta.  Tasted great!

text:
This is DELICIOUS!  I changed a few things from the original recipe.  I sauted fresh spinach and the fresh mushrooms in a separate pan with a little bit of olive oil and some fresh garlic.  I placed this mixture on the bottom of the casserole dish.  Meanwhile, I also sauted the minced garlic, lemon juice and then added cream of mushroom soup, Italian seasoning, 1/2 and 1/2, and parmesan.  I had some left over pesto from another recipe, so I put in about a Tbsp and a half to this mixture.  I placed raw chicken breasts onto of the spinach mixture.  Poured the soup mixture on top of that and then topped with mozzarella and bacon bits.  Wow!!! I am making this again soon!

text:
So much flavor!! I cooked Amish chicken strips in a pan, set aside, then made the buttery, mushroom and spinach sauce in the same pan to get some of the chicken flavor. I used frozen chopped spinach instead of canned, less butter and 2% milk instead of half and half. I put brown rice on the bottom of the pan, put the chicken on top and then topped with the creamy sauce. It cooked for 30 mins, the rice wasn't quite done so I added chicken broth and mozzarella and baked for another 15 mins. Next time I'll cook the rice before baking it. Very yummy!!

Great recipe.  I made this for family and friends last night and I heard after each bite... this is soo yummy.  made just a few changes: I sauteed fresh spinach in a little butter. I seasoned the chicken with garlic salt, fresh ground black pepper, & a country mix of seasons (Aldi's).  I used similar seasonings for the spinach.   SO GOOD!  The mozzarella did taste a little salty to me, but it browned beautifully on top.

text:
wow! easily a new favorite.. i chopped up a fourth of an onion, threw in some (well lots of) minced garlic with 3 tbs real butter, and threw the chicken in on low-med heat. seasoned the chicken with the italian seasoning, garlic salt, and pepper. covered periodically, then put the chicken in a baking dish.  i cooked 4 slices of bacon in the microwave and put the noodles in to cook. added a half a fresh squeezed lemon, cream of mushroom, parm , mozzo, spinach, and portabellas to the pan after removing the chicken and cooked until the spinach was wilted. poured the mixture over the chicken and bacon, and cooked at 350 for 15 min til bubbly! served over noodles, almost like a pasta sauce instead of a casserole! WONDERFUL! my fam lovvvvvved it and said they WOULDN'T CHANGE A THING! that's hard to come by!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I had to modify this recipe for what I had on hand and I halved the recipe.  After using the substitutions, I made it according to directions except I didn't precook the chicken.  My substitutions were 2 cloves of fresh garlic, lime juice instead of lemon, 8 oz. of sour cream in place of the soup, 2% milk for the half-and-half, half a bag of fresh spinach instead of canned, and four slices of cooked bacon. My chicken was still partially frozen so I sliced it into chunks and laid it on top of the fresh spinach and mushrooms.  Since the chicken was frozen, I baked it at 400 for 50 minutes in a casserole dish, adding the bacon to the top in the last 5.  Not sure if it was the spinach or the chicken that made it a little runny but it was very tasty and made an excellent sauce over mostaccioli.  Even more fresh spinach could have been used since it cooks down so much.   I know - a lot of changes from the original but it was a great recipe to begin with and easy to modify!  Thanks, Bryan!

text:
The dressing in and of itself is worth keeping this recipe! I used canned mushrooms and about 10 oz of fresh spinach instead which I sauteed in evoo before putting on the bottom of my 9x13. I didn't cook my chicken prior, either; I just cubed it and placed in on top of mushroom/spinach, then poured the sauce over and baked about a half hour (I omitted the bacon.) The chicken was a little bland, but the SAUCE WAS DELICIOUS!!! I served over bow tie pasta and everyone loved it! It was soooo simple! This would be an easy meal to throw together from your stovetop if you had frozen fully cooked chicken strips you could pop in the microwave.

I served it with brown rice to put a little nutrition as this is not the most nutritious meal you can serve!!

text:
I took great liberties with this recipe because of the ingredients I had on hand and because my kids kept interrupting the process.  I put thawed, drained frozen spinach in the bottom of the dish, layered vegetarian chicken that I had browned, and covered with sliced mushrooms.  For the sauce, I eyeballed all of the amounts.  I threw some butter, garlic, and a few squirts of lemon juice in a pan, added cream of celery soup and a little soymilk to thin it out and shook some italian seasoning on top.  I poured that over the whole dish and topped with strips of browned smart bacon.  I covered it all with an italian cheese blend and baked at 400 for 20 min.  This tasted fabulous, and my husband devoured it.  Just wanted to point out how forgiving the recipe was to all kinds of modifications!

text:
This was very good!  I changed a couple of things.  I added half of a large sauted onion to the sauce.  I sauted the spinach and mushrooms before adding them to the dish.  I also did not pre cook the chicken.  I layered the spinach and mushrooms one the bottom of the dish, then the raw chicken on top, and covered with the sause and real bacon bits.  I cooked it all at 350 for 30 minutes.  Added the mozzarella and then put back in the oven for 10 more minutes.  To finish it off,  I placed it all under the broiler for 3-5 minutes just to make the cheese a little brown and crispy.  It was awesome and I will totally be making this again!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2695393.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
EXCELLENT!!    I modified this recipe a bit.  First, I fried four strips of bacon, crumbled and set aside. I doubled the amount of mushrooms called for.  Sautéing in minced garlic and some of the bacon grease until golden.  I sautéed one and a half large bags of spinach with minced garlic, white wine, and salt, until wilted and most of the liquid was gone.  I pan fried it the chicken in bacon grease until golden on both sides. Continuing to use the same pan, I mixed together the mushroom sauce mixture, scraping up the brown bits in the pan for added flavor.  I decreased the oven temperature to 350 degrees, and baked approximately 10 minutes (the time will vary depending on the size of the chicken breasts), just until juices ran clear.  To be honest, I was Leery of trying this recipe, as I usually do not care for recipes containing canned soups.  This recipe is a definite exception.  UPDATE:  I decided to try a low fat version of this recipe by using 98% fat free mushroom soup, 1TBSP butter, and milk instead of half-n-half.  Prepared this way it is only an okay recipe.  I'll be sticking to the higher fat version.

text:
INCREDIBLE! Even my 10 month old who HATES vegetables of any kind ate this!  I did it a little different to save time and make sure the chicken stayed more moist. 1. I used a bag of frozen spinach, thawed. then sauteed the spinach with a little minced garlic to remove excess moisture. 2. I layered the spinach in the bottom of the baking dish and added 1 can of artichoke hearts quartered since I hate mushrooms. 3. I used 3 thawed boneless skinless chicken breasts and cut them in to chunks and put that over the spinach and artichoke hearts in the baking dish. 3. I prepared the sauce as it said to, adding 1/4 cup mozzarella to the mixture. 4. Baked it at 350 for 30 mins, then added 1 cup mozzarella to the top and baked it for another 10 mins.  It was a little runny so i let it sit for about 20 mins. 4. I cooked angel hair pasta and served the casserole over the pasta.  So Yummy! I will make this a family go to recipe. Even tasted better the next day!

text:
I followed the other reviewers' suggestions and did not bake the chicken first (skip step 1). This allows the chicken to cook in the sauce mixture and it comes out very tender (I did increase the cooking time in the oven though). I also did not put the cheese and bacon bits on the top and everyone in my family raved at how good it was! I think it would still be great with the cheese/bacon bits, but our preference was without. It's a great recipe though. Thanks for sharing!

text:
I used cream of chicken soup because that was all I had on hand. I didn't bake my chicken, I sauteed it in a little EVOO and minced garlic before I added it to the casserole ingredients, just because so many reviewers complained of it making the chicken bland. I made no other changes. My family seemed to just be okay with this dish, my sister in law flipped for it. I sent all the leftovers home with her. I didn't think that my family could finish another whole meal of this. This dish would be better cooked with lower calorie ingredients as it's incredibly rich and heavy as is. I'd like to play with this recipe again to see if I can't make it lighter.

text:
This is wonderful! For time purposes, I ended up slicing the chicken breasts & I cooked them on the stovetop. I added white wine to the spinach/mushroom mixture before adding the can of soup. I used fat free milk instead of half & half and I only used a small handful of parm! Then I added the chicken to the sauce/veggie mixture & I let it boil for a little while. Well, I believe the wine & fat free milk made my mixture too thin-- so I ended up having waaay too much sauce! Again for time purposes I added cooked rice to the sauce until all the sauce was absorbed. This way I ended up with a one pot dish essentially & I saved a lot of calories by omitting the mozza cheese. I didn't follow the instructions exactly but I did follow the ingredients almost to a tee. The taste is to die for! This is a great recipe & I'll make it again... as instructed next time :)

text:
Not bad there was enough cream sauce to feed an army though.  I did change the recipe a bit. I replaced the Cream of Mushroom with Campbell’s healthy choice low fat and sodium cream of mushroom.  I used 12 slices of precooked real bacon (way too much), Skim milk instead of half and half and Romano instead of Parmesan Cheese.  I skipped the precooking instructions and laid the raw chicken in the pan, and cooked the entire thing uncovered at 350 for 40 minutes.  The Chicken came out perfectly tender.  However I found the cream sauce to be a little over powering perhaps I might have enjoyed it more without the bacon and less heavy on the Romano cheese.  I found that while eating it I drank 3 glasses of water so maybe too much flavor for my taste.  I will probably try it again with a few more changes.

I am a beginner cooker, This was the first I ever tried and it came out great! There are 7 people in my family so I doubled the recipe. photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674156.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I gave this recipe five stars as it has the potential to be a fabulous dish.  I used leftovers from a chicken I cooked in the crockpot so I avoided the first part in having pre-cooked chicken.  I also used canned mushrooms which were fine, but fresh would have been better.  I did use fresh bacon, about 4 pieces, and I wish I'd made more.  It gave the dish an excellent flavor.  The dish was a bit rich on it's own but my husband loved it so I think it was just me.  However, for leftovers I made some noodles to go with it and even my one year old loved it!  So, after being husband/baby approved, here are my suggestions:
-Use fresh bacon, at least 4 pieces but mores better.
-Canned mushrooms/spinach are fine but fresh would probably be better(follow previous users' suggestions).
-Cook some sort of noodles to go with it, but don't add until casserole is done(I used penne and spaghetti noodles).
*I've also thought about making this into a pizza, just add crust and cut the sauce back, maybe add some feta cheese too.  All in all, a great success with lots of possibilities.

Display Name:
nucook

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674160.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
My husband love this and I thought it was pretty good.  I followed someone else's suggestion to cube the chicken and saute it in a pan with seasoning salt and garlic (I added the garlic here instead of the sauce).  I made the sauce as directed except used skim milk since I didn't have half and half.  I also added a couple of splashes of white wine. I then layered as directed using one bag of frozen spinach and part of 1 can since the frozen wasn't enough to layer the bottom.  The frozen was much more attractive and I swear I could taste the difference...next time I will make sure to have more frozen...canned spinach was ick!  I  I'm not crazy about bacon so I only used 1/3 cup.  I used about 3 cups of mozz cheese baked as directed but used the broiler for the last couple of minutes so that the cheese was nicely browned.  Good leftovers.  I think it will be a 5* next time because I won't use canned spinach.

text:
This dish was truly delicious!  My family cooks alot, so we are serious critics.  My husband especially enjoyed it and says its now his favorite baked chicken dish. A couple of personal tweaks - I used fresh sauteed spinach, instead of canned and I lightly browned the chicken breast in a skillet instead of pre-baking them.  I served the dish over fettuccine, along with a simple cherry tomato salad with balsamiic vinaigrette.  Perfect dish for company!

text:
This was very good!  I only used half of the Italian seasoning but doubled all of the other ingredients except the garlic - that, I just pressed 3 cloves through the garlic press.  I cooked the chicken in the oven as recipe stated.  However, I shredded it instead of keeping them whole.  I also added about 1/2 a box of fettucini.  Mixed it all together and topped with cheese.  I used Fontina as that is all I had on hand.  It was very rich but super!  Will make again!  Probably in Fall or Winter as it is such a hearty meal.  Also, I used frozen whole leaf spinach.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I took this recipe and modified it, to my own tastes and in light of some of the suggestions by other members. I used chicken tenders and cut them into chunks, sauteed them untill cooked in 1/2 the butter, added the mushrooms for the last 4mins. In a sep. pan, I made the sauce however I doubled the lemon juice and half and half (fat free) to make more of a sauce. I used the remaining butter, 1/2 tbls. herbs de provence, and 1 can of cream of chicken and mushroom soup. garlic and parmesean I left the same. Once that was done i stirred in the spinach, and tossed everything together with rigatonne pasta. I did not use bacon or mozerella. 
It ended up being a chicken florentine pasta, instead of a casserole, but I thought it turned out great.

text:
This was good except the fact that my casserole ended up to be very salty. I used grilled chicken seasoned with garlic salt (had leftovers),salted butter (didnt have unsalted) and also cheddar cheese instead of mozzarella (all I had). These my changes with bacon bites (also pretty salty) on the top made it very salty. So next time I will be really careful what I put in, definitely will reduce bacon bites (a little overhelming for me) and try to put the layer of mashed potatoes. This is a keeper even though it didnt work out very well the first time :)

text:
VERY GOOD and easy !
I too 'healthied' this dish, used a little olive oil instead of butter, used evap skim milk instead of cream, only 1 C cheese on top. Kept the bacon for flavor [1/3c]
Iused a bag of baby spinach, microwaved a little and used 8 oz sliced mushrooms... not enough spinach! it disappeared. The sauce was almost too italian spiced, but I used the Emeril brand of Italian spice, maybe 1 TB of another brand would not be so powerful. Did not precook chicken, just cooked covered 30 min then uncovered and added cheese. A winner w/my husband!

text:
Really awesome recipe. I doubled the mushrooms (could probably even quadruple them if you really like mushrooms) and sauteed them in olive oil and fresh garlic. I also squeezed all the water out of the spinach using a sieve and a wooden spoon. I also did not put the full amount of bacon bits in as I was afraid  that it would overpower the dish. I brushed the chicken with olive oil and sprinkled it with garlic pepper, parsley flakes, basil, and seasoned salt before  it.
My boyfriend LOVED this dish and compared it to something you would get at the Olive Garden. I personally think it's way better than anything you could get there, but he loves that place, so it's all good :)

This dish was absolutely wonderful.  It could possible be the best dish I've made from this website, and I get a lot of good recipes here.  I read that other people substitued milk for the half and half to reduce calories.  Well, I did the opposite.  I only had heavy cream in the fridge and didn't want to run to the store, so heavy cream was substituted.  As I was stirring the pot, I was a little worried that the italian seasoning would take over the taste.  I was a little bummed that I had added it - but when it was cooked in, it was fabulous.  The sauce was a nice consistency and we served it over pasta.  Definitely restaurant quality.

this dish has great potential in that the flavors were wonderful, but i think the recipe needs adjustment.  first of all it came out watery, so i would start by either draining the spinach or starting with fresh spinach maybe.  by putting two cups of cheese on top, the cheese doesn't mix in so the sauce stayed a bit thin, and the cheese just browned on top.  i think if you mixed the two cups of cheese into the sauce, it would make for a better sauce as well.

will definitely try again, but making the adjustments for a better and less watery sauce.

I cooked up a large container of baby spinach in a little butter and then drained well. I also cooked up two containers of sliced baby bells mushrooms in a little butter and drained. Placed the spinach in the bottom of the baking dish, then mushrooms and the raw chicken on top. I covered with sauce and real bacon bits. Cooked at 350 until almost done and then put the mozzarella and popped back in the oven.

None
text:
I made Chicken Florentine, following some of the modifications others suggested, and added some of my own. First, I used leftover rotisserie chicken breasts and cut them up into bite sized pieces. I sautèed the  mushrooms in 2 tbsp butter (not 1/4 cup!) along with half an onion, minced, and I added the minced garlic just before adding the mushroom soup. I added 2% milk to the soup rather than half and half. I cooked the fresh spinach (not canned-yuck!) in the microwave and added it to the sauce along with the chunks of chicken. I could see that the sauce, vegetables and chicken were going to make a small amount for dinner, so I cooked about 4 ounces of farfalle pasta and mixed the cooked pasta with the sauce mixture. I sprayed an 8 x 8 inch pan with cooking spray and put the sauce/pasta/chicken/spinach mixture into it.  I sprinkled shredded 3-cheese Italian cheese and bacon bits over the mixture and baked it for 25 minutes at 350ºF. My husband and I rated this dish as a keeper!

text:
1)I used 1 bag cooking spinach, sauteed with one giant pack mushrooms in butter.  poured in white wine and used salt, pepper, garlic.

2) I diced the chicken (5 breasts) roughly in big chunks and then pan fried it a bit (not fully cooked but the outside ready).  **next time dice it up smaller - 2cm x 2cm instead of 1 inch by 1.5 etc

3) don't be shy with the sauce, it's excellent.  double up next time, cause dang.

4) plan to serve with garlic toasted bread, and maybe toss in asparagus tips for freshness?  consider a bed of spaghetti to serve with/over.  Maybe zoodles.  The fresh would be a pleasant contrast to the heaviness of the baked dish

text:
This is a fabulous 5 star recipe when making the alterations suggested by the "most helpful reviews", so the recipe as written gets 4 stars.  Browning the chicken in a skillet (rather than baking it) gives it so much more flavor as well as preventing the chicken from being overcooked.   Due to personal preference, I used fresh spinach, freshly fried bacon, and omitted the mushrooms.  Doing this provided an absolutely scrumptious entree.  TIP: if not serving over pasta or rice, I suggest having some warm, crusty bread to sop up the sauce.  It's just so tasty you'll want to eat every drop.  It was loved by all, so I will be making this again!

text:
This was ok. I did follow recommendations to saute the spinach, mushroom, onion (which I added) and garlic in butter. Spread across the bottom of casserole dish and added the uncooked chicken on top. Sprinkled with more garlic, onion, bacon, the creamy sauce and some mozzarella at the end. Cooked it about 45 min. The chicken was just too big and chunky. I think next time I'll cut into smaller pieces. Also, there was too much "juice" from the spinach (maybe because I used frozen). It didn't blend well with the cream sauce mixture at the end. Maybe next time I'll use canned or try and drain/dry it better. The flavor, however, was really good (we just had to keep stirring/blending it). I also might add more than 3-4 strips bacon next time. I forgot to add white wine, so I might try that next time too. It's a keeper, just needs some tweaking.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5609025.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Fanastic.  I used about 14 ounces of spinach and about 20 ounces of cubed chicken that I sautéed.  But, a pound of cubed   Chicken would work also.  I used fresh grated Parmesan. I also used fresh garlic. I followed the recipe exactly  
I   Fried bacon,   (  1/2 pound) set aside,  wiped out the pan and put a little butter in it and cooked the chicken cubes till just done.   Still juicy, about five minutes. Don't over cook. Then I sautéed the mushroom , added the spinach without water and cooked till the spinach was completely wilted.   Put in the 9 x 13 and poured half of the sauce over it , chicken and more sauce, ( as instructed) , then the bacon and mozzarella,  I only used one cup of mozzarella.  That was enough.  This is definitely our favorite, can't wait for the leftovers.sounds like a lot of work, but it isn’t.   The first time always takes longest. I served it over bow tie pasta.

text:
I took the suggestions made in one of the comments and skipped the first step of baking the chicken in the oven, and just layered the raw chicken into the casserole container. The biggest issue I had was that the dish was way too saucy. It was much less like a casserole and more like I was fishing for pieces of chicken. If I make this in the future, I think I will cut down on the sauce and cut the pieces of chicken much smaller which will hopefully make it more casserole-like.

However, although the consistency was off, it tasted pretty darn good :)

I loved this after i did it my way, I followed all the ingredients on the recipe the only thing i did differently was use the stove top instead off the oven, I cooked my chicken breast until lightly browned, then added all the other ingredients and cooked until mushrooms were tender the turned the heat to low and topped it with cheese and crumbled bacon, It was great very flavorful and moist. I find that the oven dries the chicken out to much. and this way its all done in about 20 minutes.

AWESOME!!!!! Did make a few changes after reading reviews.
Cut chicken in halves (thick breasts), seared, then set aside. In same skillet, sautéed portabella mushrooms in butter. When almost tender, added 2 bags of baby spinach and sautéed   till wilted. After draining extra liquid, put on bottom of dish, sprinkled crushed red pepper over . Then in same skillet, made sauce   as directed. Served over fettuccini . text:
I love this dish, and have made it several times. I disagree with those who don't pre-bake the chicken as instructed. I think this is a for food-safety reasons. I definitely would not cook this dish with raw chicken.  Also, I use 2 boxes of frozen spinach,  defrosted and well-drained. Also, I prefer to use two large chicken breasts, cut in half, as there is more of the delicious sauce per serving.  I only serve two people.

text:
Agreed with other comments about not baking chicken. I sautéed 1 oz mushrooms and 5oz fresh spinach with butter then added 1 clove minced garlic for another minute, scooped into into baking (8x11) dish and added lemon juice (stirred in). Placed raw chicken (4 breasts cut in half long ways).  In a bowl I stirred together soup, Parmesan cheese, whole milk, and Italian seasoning and then scooped on top of chicken. Sprinkled the bacon bits and covered with the mozzarella cheese. It probably baked for 45 mins before done. Tasted awesome!

userID:
3964202
Display Name:
Teri Scott
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1301524.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
WOW!!! Excellent with the previous reviewers changes plus a few of my own- I fried 4 pieces of bacon in a skillet, removed the bacon then added 1/2 stick butter to the bacon grease,  1 1/2 pounds baby portabella mushrooms (I LOVE mushrooms) sliced into 3rd's,  a bag of fresh spinach, 1 chopped onion and 5 cloves sliced garlic. Sauteed down for a few minutes then put into a Pam sprayed 13x9 baking dish. I left the liquid behind in the pan. I chopped 4 raw boneless skinless chicken breasts into bite size pieces, put these on top of the mushroom spinach mixture. Then 1 put 1 family size can of cream of mushroom soup into the pan along with the mushroom liquid that the mushroom and spinach had come out of,  added 1/2 cup half and half, 1/2 tsp. garlic powder, 2 tsp. Italian seasoning, and 1 cup mozzarella cheese (didn't have any parmesan). I warmed this until the cheese was melted and everything was mixed. I poured this over the chicken. I sprinkled the bacon pieces over the top and baked for 25 minutes uncovered at 350 degrees. Then I added another cup of mozzarella cheese over the top and baked 15 more minutes at 350. I served it over fettucini. Will make this again! Good enough for company! Delicious!!

text:
I try to crowd-source the best suggestions on recipe alterations. Halved the Italian seasoning; could have used more. Milk 1% instead of half-and-half; plenty rich enough. Fresh baby spinach, about three leaves deep; should be a bit more as spinach tends to vanish. Cremini mushrooms worked well. Cut four strips of bacon across width into quarter-inch pieces and fried until crispy; spread on top. Baked uncovered; still liquid enough to pour on top of noodles, though we had it straight up. Three thumbs up at dinner last night; just finished for today's lunch. Good thing I made two!

userID:
4452392
Display Name:
bellepepper
isPro:
False
followersCount:
535

867

recipesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/433303.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
After reading a number of the reviews for this recipe, I decided to give it a try.  Like many others, I changed this up quite a bit.  Here’s what I did.  I made about half the recipe, using a splash of white wine for the lemon juice, half a can of the mushroom soup, freezing the other half, only ½ t. of Italian seasoning, milk for the half and half, and a 10 oz. box of frozen chopped spinach.  I totally skipped the bacon bits, and cut the mozzarella in half.  I cooked the spinach according to the package, cooled it, and squeezed out the excess liquid.  I put that in the bottom of a 9x9 casserole.  I sautéed the mushrooms and put them on top of the spinach.  I wanted the chicken to have some color, so I browned one side only and put it on top of the mushrooms.  I made the sauce pretty much as written, using the white wine I mentioned, and I put the mozzarella cheese in the sauce instead of on top of the casserole.  I spooned the sauce over the chicken, covered and refrigerated this until I was ready to pop it in the oven.  I left it covered and baked it at 350 for about 30 minutes.  When I was making the sauce I thought it was too thick, but after it baked it seemed fine.  We liked this combination very much, but if I make it again, I’d like to try a more flavorful cheese like Swiss.

text:
Instead of baking chicken for 20 min, sear each side on high heat in olive oil, making sure to keep the middle pink.  This locked in the juices; it was so moist, I didn't even need a knife to cut the chicken.  After layering spinach, sauce, chicken, and cheese, bake in oven at 350 for 20-25 min.

The hubby gave this two thumbs up.  I sauteed the spinach and mushrooms, then put them in the bottom of the casserole dish.   Next I added bite sized (raw) pieces of chicken.  I poured the sauce on top, then added the bacon bits.  25 minutes in a 350 degree oven, then topped with mozzarella and baked an additional 10 minutes.  Yum!  The sauce was a little thin, so next time I think I'll add the soup without milk or cream.

text:
Great recipe. I modified it for a slow cooker. I mixed the mushroom soup, garlic, milk (instead of half and half) lemon juice, italian seasoning with chicken breast (cut into bite-sized pieces. Cooked for 3 hours on low. Added a bunch of fresh spinach, parmesean cheese, mixed and continued to cook for 1 hr. Added fresh, cleaned diced mushrooms in the last 20 minutes. Cooked some angel hair pasta, drained  and mixed with the chicken mixture. Topped with pre-cooked crumbled bacon.  The family love it. It is a keeper.
Omitted the butter. .  . not necessary here.

Didn't love it.  Made it pretty much as described.  Did sauté the spinach (no mushrooms since I had none) in a bit of butter, then added a bit of white wine and a clove of minced garlic to the spinach after it was quite wilted and continued sautéing another minute or two as suggested by another reviewer.   I placed this at the bottom of my pan.    Used cream of chicken soup since I had no cream of mushroom soup on hand in "white" layer, then mixed in my chicken.  These changes didn't stray much from the original recipe, so I don't think they were the reason I didn't much like this dish.  It just needed something else....perhaps rice or pasta.  The reason I chose this recipe was because it didn'include those ingredients and I am always looking for low carb recipes to serve my diabetic husband.   I'm not saving this one to my recipe box.

region:

country:
None
text:
I have already done it twice, and I have loved it each time. I have skipped the first step which is bake the chicken first and went right away to sautéing the mushroom and spinach with butter. Then I put that in a oven pan on the bottom and spread them there. After that I put the raw chicken on the mixture and I poured the sauce on top of it. Preheat the oven at 350-400. Put the pan in the oven at 350 for 25-30 mins depending on your preference. Take it out, put the mozzarella cheese on it and give it another 10-15 mins in the oven at 350. Take it out and enjoy the goodness!!

country:
None
text:
Gave it 4 stars because if I hadn't changed cooking time it would've burned it & used way to many dishes. I baked the chicken in a 9x9 pan for 20 min & even though they were thick chicken breasts they were almost done. If using thinner ones watch the cooking time. 2nd I used fresh spinach not the canned. 3rd I used bacon cooked over bacon bites. That was just a personal preference again. 4th I didn't return to the oven on 400 like instructions but back to the 350 & it only needed an additional 10 min. This is a good basic recipe, but watch the cooking time & oven temp or nothing you do will help the outcome.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I read the other reviewers comment about pre-cooking the chicken being unnecessary, which sounded right to me. So I layered the spinach, mushrooms, chicken and sauce, and since my chicken breasts were huge (seriously, I could only fit three in the pan) baked it at 350 for 35 minutes, topped with crumbled bacon and mozzarella, and baked for another 10. My husband, who dislikes cooked spinach, loved it and wants me to make it again soon. Next time I will use a larger pan, as it barely fit in my 9x9, and I will adjust the times to cook for 15 minutes with the mozzarella, since I prefer slightly browned cheese. I may also slice the breasts into smaller pieces if they're as big as these were, or maybe just use chicken tenderloins.

text:
A good recipe, with the potential to become a regular.  I anticipated that it would be too rich, so I diluted the sauce with a bit of whole milk, and left off the bacon bits and the second half of the cheese.  Turns out it was the right decision, because what I had in the end was just right for me.  Like others, I did not pre-bake the chicken, and it needed 35-40 minutes at 350 uncovered to be cooked through.  Served with brown rice, which was perfect to soak uo all the delicious sauce!

text:
Very good!! I did make some slight changes, per other reviewers. I only used 3 chicken breast halves. I cooked my bacon and then I sauteed the chicken for a very short time in the bacon grease(I also cut the chicken into bite size pieces).  I used 1 bag of fresh spinach, I also sauteed the spinach and mushrooms in a little butter. Then I put my spinach mix on the bottom of the pan, next my chicken pieces,  Then the VERY VERY good sauce and finally the bacon pieces. Cooked at 350 for around 20 minutes, then put 1 cup mozzarella on top and cooked for another 10 minutes. EXCELLENT!!! Will make again.

text:
This is an AWESOME recipe!  I've made it several times - and my family - especially the KIDS - just LOVE it!  I sometimes just cook the chicken on the stove top a few minutes on each side to save time, I use turkey bacon bits instead of the "real thing" (since my hubby doesn't eat pork) and I don't use quite as much cheese as the recipe calls for (cholesterol issues in the family).  Otherwise, I go with the recipe as is!  It's one of the few we all can agree on...quick, easy, and YUMMY! 

Thanks for such a great recipe!

text:
I didn't bother cooking the chicken first. I had thin breasts and cut those into serving size pieces. I used 8 oz sliced mushroom and an entire large clamshell of fresh spinach sautéed with the garlic. Everything but the mozzarella was baked, covered, for about 30 min. then added cheese and crushed bacon and popped it back in to finish cooking uncovered. Very tasty. Make sure you use enough Italian seasoning. Served with rice and really liked it the next day in my lunch!

text:
This is SO good. I did what other reviewers said and sautéed the spinach and mushrooms with  bit of garlic in butter before putting it in the dish. Chopped up the chicken in bite size pieces and heated them a bit in the sauce (which I made exactly as recipe stated) and then topped the spinach with sauce and poured the chicken in the sauce over the spinach and topped with bacon bits. Cooked 25 min at 350. Put mozzarella on and cooked for 10 more min at 400. Topped on whole wheat pasta I made with butter, parm, garlic, and parsley. My daughter said this is one of her favorite things I've ever made... So guess it's a keeper!

text:
The flavor was OK but it had way too much sauce which really overpowered the spinach and the mushrooms.  I used fresh spinach and wilted it in the microwave and then drained it well.  I doubled the mushrooms but we couldn't find them in all the sauce.  I also used 1% milk but only 1/4 cup. I sliced the chicken breast into 3 strips each and sautéed them in a little olive oil for about 5 minutes.   IF I make this again I will decrease the sauce and only use 1/2 Tbls of the Italian seasoning.

text:
Served this to guests and everyone raved.  I agree with  reviewers tips of using fresh spinach (be prepared that once sautéed, you need at least one large clam shell  of spinach) and also liked chopping the pre baked chicken into cubes.  This way people do not have to take a large piece of chicken - they can customize the quantity.  I served with risotto and a sweet kale salad.  The Italian spice is key to the flavour.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2762467.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
First off, I did not have half and half so i just used milk and it came out flavorful (I will use half and half next time). The only change i would make is to use fresh spinach (the can spinach was not my taste). I will saute fresh spinach and the mushrooms with butter and layer both the bottom and one layer over the chicken, then add the sauce, bacon then cheese. Also, I only baked it for 20 minutes and it was still pink, I believe this helped it from not drying out. It was juicy, tender (frozen and thawed chicken) and flavorful.

text:
I always read the reviews of other people who have made it exactly like the recipe and go from there. I did make a couple of changes I used 1/2 a jar of Alfredo sauce instead of the half and half and parmesan cheese. I also didn't bake the chicken but browned it in skillet to keep the meat moist. I removed the chicken and made my sauce in the same skillet I had just cooked the chicken in. It was great. Everyone loved it. I will make this again.

YUM. I expected this to be good, but it went far beyond. I followed the changes suggested by FOXFIRE2 (sauteing the spinach and mushrooms with minced garlic, cubing the chicken, using white wine in the sauce, etc.),  baked it for 40 min. (note: you may need to cover with aluminum foil to prevent overbrowning), and it was perfect. The chicken was juicy and flavorful and the creamy sauce was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. I served it over rice, and it was a hit.

country:
None
text:
I soaked the chicken breasts for several hours in a highly citrus marinade, known for wide use in good restaurants before covering them in foil and baking them, so they come out juicy and ready for the casserole dish.  The key secret to Bryan's amazing Chicken Florentine model here is how well the sauce ingredients infuse together, when you "low and slow" simmer it in the saucepan ; the longer, the better--then, take it off heat to cool / thicken.  As you enjoy this the first time--you're going to get inspired to add your own tweaks, but prepared as instructed is very close to restaurant quality.

text:
I just made it easier.  I placed the raw chicken on the bottom of the dish, put a bag of baby spinach over the top, put a box on mushrooms on top of that, then poured the sauce over the top( I did double the sauce and used 6 cloves of fresh crushed garlic. I used whipping cream only 1/2C) baked for 40min. same temp.  Put cooked bacon and cheese on top during the last 15min.  Great combination of ingredients, it was a hit.  Thank you!!

Display Name:
busynurseandmom

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2346897.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This dish was amazing. I used all the ingredients, but added them differently. I agree with other reviews, do not cook the chicken first, it is tough as nails if you do. I sautéed the mushrooms and spinach first, then just added the sauce ingredients to that. I simmered that for a little bit, put a couple spoons of the sauce on the bottom of the casserole dish, laid the raw chicken breasts on top of that, poured the rest of the sauce on top of the chicken, and cooked it for 30 minutes. Took the dish out of the oven, put on moz. cheese, then bacon and put back in the oven for 15 minutes. It was to die for!!! One last piece of advice, I would use thinner chicken breast if possible. The ones I bought were so thick it would have taken forever for them to cook, so I just cut them length wise in half. Came out perfect.

My husband and two teenage daughters loved this!  I sautéed 6 chicken breasts in olive oil.  I put a few layers of fresh spinach in the bottom of a 9x13 pan, put the sautéed chicken on top, covered it with the sauce and then sprinkled real bacon pieces on top. I made 50% extra sauce for the two extra chicken breasts, but it really wasn't necessary, and  I only used 1 cup of cheese.  Delicious!!

text:
I took other's advice and did not pre-cook my chicken. I instead filleted my chicken breasts in half to make them thinner and reduce their cook time. I also deleted the bacon and instead cut 2 Tbsp of butter into small pieces and arranged in bottom of prepared casserole dish before piling fresh baby spinach on top. I layered raw sliced mushrooms on top of spinach before covering with raw thin chicken fillets. I poured sauce mix over chicken breasts, grated more fresh Parmesan cheese on top before sprinkling with shredded Mozarrela/Romano cheese. Baked uncovered until chicken was cooked thru and bubbling hot. About 40 minutes. Served over long grain white rice.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Delicious!! I didn't have all the ingredients, and needed to make only two servings, so here's what I did.  I steamed a 10 oz bag of fresh spinach in the microwave for two minutes, then cut holes in the bag and left in the sink to drain a bit.  I mixed granulated garlic, lemon juice, seasoning, and Parmesan cheese with the cream of mushroom soup for the sauce.  With the moisture from the spinach, adding milk or half and half wasn't necessary.  I didn't have mozzarella, so used a little goat cheese over the spinach, then a little cheddar over the top of the chicken.  Odd combination, I know, but it worked!  It will be even more delicious when I have shopped for the proper ingredients!! Thanks for sharing this delicious low carb recipe!  I'll use this again and again, both for company and "just us"!  Oh, and I skipped the first step, and put just baked the whole thing at 375 for 20-30 minutes (depending on size of chicken pieces).

country:
None
text:
Like a number of other reviewers, I made a few changes, but concur that the basic recipe is pretty dang good. Changes made: thighs (instead of breasts); cooked on the stove with a tiny bit of olive oil (instead of dry in the oven); unsweetened almond milk (instead of 1/2 & 1/2 or milk); 1 bag fresh spinach (instead of frozen); 1/4 c chopped red bell pepper (for the color to combat the "ugliness" of the dish otherwise; served over rice (instead of as-is with bacon bits).
Thankfully, it freezes well in small portions so that I didn't tuck in and just eat the whole pan at once. I liked it very much.

userID:
8567909
Display Name:
sweetkness
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
81
favoritesCount:
1323
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614260.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe is a nice starting idea, but I rated it poorly due to the number of things I had to/chose to change.  1. Made the recipe healthier by only using 1/8 cup butter, 1% milk instead of half and half and only 1 cup of mozzarella cheese on top.  You still end up with a nice creamy sauce and it is plenty of cheese.  2.  Used 2 - 10 oz. packages frozen spinach, it gets lots of spinach into the recipe and is cheaper than the fresh spinach...it gets cooked down anyways.  Also used 8 oz. mushrooms because that's the amount that usually comes in a package.  3.  Used 6 chicken breasts instead of 4.  4.  Made the prep process much easier.  Saute the mushrooms in butter, mix in spinach until heated through, layer on bottom of baking dish, arrange chicken on top, cover with sauce, bake for 30 minutes, top with cheese, bake for additional 10 minutes, top with real crumbled bacon before serving.  The chicken was properly cooked through.

text:
This was a really great meal with a few alterations.  I used fat free 1/2 and 1/2 and only a couple tablespoons of butter for the mushrooms and garlic.  It is such a rich meal that the alterations truly did not make a difference but cut out some fat.  I marinated the chicken first in a little italian dressing and added about a 1/4 cup of pinot grigio to hot baking dish last minute and let it simmer for a few before adding the spinich/mushroom/sauce mix to the bottom of the pan.  We ended up using less cheese but this may have been because we only had a couple chicken breasts.  I will definately make this again for company!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
delicious and perfect for a nice, heavy occasional meal! I started with the bacon in a cast iron skillet and browned, set aside, and browned the chicken in the same pan with the bacon drippings before putting the entire pan in the oven for 20 mins on 350. I made my own cream of mushroom from scratch, added a little extra milk, butter, freshly grated garlic and nutmeg, and simmered until thick. After removing the skillet with the chicken from the oven, I removed it from the pan and wilted 2 bags of fresh baby spinach into that same skillet with 2 tb butter and 1/2 cup white wine until the spinach was wilted. Topped the spinach with 1/2 the sauce and finished as the recipe stated. BRILLIANT!

text:
DH gave it 5 stars, I gave it 3, so I averaged at 4 :)  We are not big mushroom people, so I subbed out onions for the mushrooms, and cream of chicken for the cream of mushroom.  I made my own bacon bits.  I sauteed fresh spinach with the onion in some butter and some leftover bacon grease.  I did not cook the chicken, but cut it up and put it on top of the spinach. Served everything over bowtie pasta.  Everything was good, but a little too rich for my liking.  I will make this again, but sub out some of the butter and not use bacon grease to sautee the spinach.  I will admit, this was very tasty, just a bit too heavy.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Good, although I did make some changes (like 2000 other people, I see). I used fat-free milk instead of half and half, "healthy recipe" soup, only one tablespoon of butter and one cup of reduced-fat mozzarella. I seared the chicken in a pan on the stove in a little olive oil spray, then removed the chicken, added the butter, chopped mushrooms and garlic to the same pan and made the sauce there. I also used two 10 oz packages of frozen spinach. Four stars for the recipe as written because 2/3 cup of bacon bits is REALLY a lot (I pretty much covered the top of my dish with two tablespoons), and because baking is probably the least flavorful way to make chicken ever. Next time I would add some salt to the spinach before covering with the chicken and sauce.

country:
None
text:
The sauce is rich and delicious although very salty.  The bacon provides a wonderful smokey flavor.  Very elegant dish. For those cooking in high altitudes, if you skip step one as some of the reviewers suggest and put raw chicken, cut into chunks, in the casserole, I recommend turning the oven up to 365 and cooking for 40 minutes.  Chicken will be cooked through and very juicy and tender.  Don't wait to put the mozzarella cheese on top. It will cook just fine without burning.

I will be making this dish regularly.  Thank you Bryan0320 for this fantastic recipe which is good enough for company.

Display Name:
perez4640

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614249.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Another keeper. Cubed and cooked the chicken first(boiled), sauteed with half a diced onion and a clove of garlic (minced) in bacon grease from the 4 pieces of bacon I cooked first. In separate pan sauteed fresh mushrooms (16 oz) and a bag of fresh spinach, with two cloves of garlic (minced) and a splash of white wine. Spread the spinach/mushroom mixture on bottom of casserole dish, leaving juices in pan. Used left over juices to start white sauce. Mixed chicken and onion in white sauce and spread over top of spinach/mushrooms. Crumbled bacon on top. And topped with about a cup of mozzarella. Baked at 350 for 20 minutes while rice was cooking. (1 cup rice)

text:
This is an excellent basic recipe and even better the next day. Sorry, but I did adjust some things to suite my personal taste. 
Next time I'll use about 1/2 the amount of Parmesan (too salty) and cut the Mozzarella a bit, maybe use a little less butter and add some wine. (Meant to add it anyway but forgot). I used FF cream, frozen spinach (should have used fresh), and left over roasted chicken. 
I don't care for Italian Seasoning but if I had used it, I would cut it back to 1 tsp. at the most.
Used about 1/2 tsp. each Thyme and Basil. I may  try some Rosemary too.
Thank you for a great new recipe. I will make it many times.

text:
This is an awesome dish! I did make some adjustments, suggested by other reviewers. I left out the mushrooms (not a fan). I sauteed fresh spinach (two bags) with olive oil and minced garlic. I cooked some bacon in the same pan, then sauteed the chicken breasts in the same pan (after removing most of the bacon grease). I added chopped dried onion to the sauce and used skim milk instead of 1/2 & 1/2. I also put a little part-skim mozzarella in with the cream sauce, as well as on top. I baked (uncovered) at 375 for about 30 minutes. Delicious!

Ok, I followed this to the t... it was amazing! I loved it a lot and my husband could NOT stop eating this. Hahahaha... my only recomended change would be... DON'T USED CANNED SPINACH.  I used canned spinach from safeway and it just tasted so odd. I drained it, but it still seemed really mushy after I cooked this and it had a really... really metalicy grassy flavor... like... I pulled spinach straight out of an ocean or something. LOL... I'm not a cook by any means and the rest of this recipe is amazing and I will DEFINITELY make this again... but next time I might just try cooking my own spinach up first then using that.. .or frozen spinach. Because the canned stuff was a little overpowering in taste... and not goo taste.  Thanks for sharing this recipe!

userID:
2834527
Display Name:
Maureen
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
4
favoritesCount:
510
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614248.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Love this recipe!!! It was delicious!!! My BF said it tasted like something from a fancy restaurant!! I did make a few changes in the preparatation just because it was easier for me. I boiled the chicken breasts in chicken broth the day before and cubed it up. I cooked the mushrooms in butter and then added the garlic, lemon, 2 cans of soup, italian seasoning, half and half (a little more than 1/2 cup since I used 2 cans of soup), parmesan cheese. I bought 2 bags fresh spinach leaves at the store and wilted them in the microwave for 2 minutes. Put them in a colander and drained them well and then tore them into pieces on the bottom of the pan. Make sure you spray Pam on the baking dish for easy clean up. I put the spinach in, then half of the soup mixture, then the cubed chicken, the remaining soup, bacon bits, and topped with the mozzarella. Served it over fettucini noodles. DELICIOUS!!! Can't wait for the leftovers tonight!!!

This was amazing!  Am trying it for the second time tomorrow night and this time I will have all the ingredients.  The first time I had no mushrooms, lemon juice and had to subsitute milk for the half and half (used 1/4 cup).  Also I used fresh spinach which I wilted in a pan.  It was FANTASTIC!!  Love the buttery, creamyness of it and it's a great way to use up extra spinach, leftover chicken or parmigianno reggiano.  If you can, cook the chicken however you like a day or two ahead so it's quicker to assemble.

text:
This recipe was good, but I'd make several changes if I were to make it again.  First off, there's way more sauce than my husband and I needed, so I'd cut that in half probably.  Secondly, to save calories I would try to use skim milk instead of half and half.  With the cream of mushroom, I don't think it would influence the consistency because it's already thick.  Lastly, you can cut the cheese quite a bit, too.  It was good, but there are several things I'll try to make it healthier.

userID:
1204230
Display Name:
PantryDreams
isPro:
False
followersCount:
5

88

43

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/80872.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was amazing!!! Only a few changes...Fresh spinach (ate canned spinach as a kid and can't do it) sauteed with mushrooms, onion, and garlic and layered in the bottom of the baking dish. Halved the chicken breasts and sauteed them until brown on both sides and barely pink in the middle. Placed on the bed of spinach. Mix together juice of 1/2 a lemon, garlic, cream of mushroom soup, Italian seasoning, half-and-half, Parmesan cheese, and 1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes in oil, diced. Pour over chicken. Top with Mozzarella cheese and fresh bacon bits. Baked at 400F until cheese was brown and bubbly. Served with orzo and sauteed brussel sprouts. Delicious!

text:
Delish! I omitted a few ingredients bc my husband is rather picky. (No can of soup, half-and half, spinach.) I converted the recipe to 2 people. First brushed the uncooked chicken with lemon juice, then the melted butter. I then sprinkled the Italian seasoning on. I sliced 2 garlic cloves for a lighter garlic taste and placed on seasoned chicken. Then sprinkled the Parm cheese and Italian shredded cheese. Baked at 350 in a pan covered w/foil for 30 minutes. Uncovered and baked additional 20 minutes. Wow! I used the savory juices to drizzle over some mashed potatoes I made, served broccoli and it was amazing! This is definitely a keeper. Thanks for sharing! (The juices were very tasty on the broccoli, too.)

text:
This was pretty good & fairly easy to throw together. I did make a few changes based on other reviewers suggestions. First I sauteed the spinach & mushrooms in olive oil & spread it in my pan, then cut up my chicken into bite sized pieces & put it on top of the mushroom/spinach mixture uncooked. Poured the sauce on top & sprinkled bacon on top with real crumbled bacon. Cooked at 350 for 25 min. sprinkled mozzarella on top & then baked another 10 min. It was very yummy! My hubby thought it looked like slop & wasn't sure he liked it but we both enjoyed it! My only complaint was that I used 6 thin chicken breasts instead of 4 & I had a ton of sauce! I think next time I make this I will make some plain pasta & then serve this on top of pasta. That way there's not just a ton of leftover sauce.  Then this meal will be perfect!!!

Delicious, but fattening!  I used 1 1/2 bags of baby spinach as suggested and doubled the mushrooms.  I also did not pre-cook the chicken. city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I thought this was a tasty dish. I used my skillet to brown the bacon. Drained the bacon grease. Put 2 TLB of butter in the skillet, browned ~ 1/3 cup diced onion, 1 garlic clove, the splash of white wine (good suggestion by others), the Italian seasoning, drained a can of mushrooms and added that. After 1 or 2 minutes of saute, I added the spinach. After 1 or 2 minutes, I added the cream of mushroom soup, lemon juice & half-and-half. Once that was all mixed, I added the Parmesan cheese. I poured this into the 9x9 pan, sprinkled the bacon bits on top and because I didn't have Mozzarella cheese on hand, I used an aged white cheddar. In the oven for 25 minutes and it was great over noodles! A keepr recipe!

text:
I made this recipe last night because I am sick of making boring chicken breast..I have to say it was really good .. even my PICKY husband liked it.. ! I used fresh spinach (sauteed it first to steam, frozen would work too.. but I am not a fan of canned)-  I also had a big portobella mushroom i wanted to use, so i diced that and used it instead of regular mushrooms. I basically did what the recipe said except I noticed the top was browning faster than the casserole was "bubbling"- so, i covered it, turned it down to 375 and baked a little longer.. I wanted the casserole to bubble a little more to blend all the flavors..  Excellent with a side of angel hair pasta. .. Staple in my house.. and was very easy to make !

text:
Made this for the first time tonight and my WHOLE family Loved it! I changed a little to fit my three teenage sons who eat me out of house and home.  I used 1 bag of 2.5lb frozen chicken tenders (Target brand) and defrosted them and cooked them in a little garlic and oil. Set aside. I then cooked one bag of fresh spinage in same pan until soft. In the mean time I cooked 1 1/2lbs of pasta.  Transfered spinage as first layer in a casserole pan. Then added cooked pasta and then the chicken. I made the sauce as stated except that I did not have any 1/2 & 1/2 so I just used 2% milk. I had bacon bits left over from our superbowl party and just used those.  I added a liitle extra milk and some more garlic salt to taste and then baked for 20 min.  YUM!! and I had plenty for lunch tomorrow and snacks for after school.  Thank you for the quick and easy idea!  Will certainly be making this again!
