Delish!  I followed other reviewers' recommendations.  I sauteed the spinach (I used drained, thawed frozen) and mushrooms with a little garlic and butter (and a little salt).  I put that in the bottom of a square pyrex baking dish.  I put 4 bone-in skinless chicken thighs on top of that and poured the sauce over it.  I also added some pepper to the sauce. text:
EXCELLENT!!! Followed a Reviewer's suggestions in how to cook the chicken and it came out absolutely perfect!  Made the sauce as per the recipe but I sauteed the (fresh) spinach and sliced mushrooms in a little butter. Placed them in a greased dish. Placed the uncooked breasts on top. Added the sauce, topped it off with the bacon bits - baked for 25 min at 350F. Removed from the oven, topped with shredded cheese and returned for 10 min at the same 350F.  Moist, FLAVOURFUL, - could serve it up at a formal dinner and be very proud of the results.

text:
I just made this last night and it was a big hit w/ my family!  Adjusted a couple of things to reduce cooking time and richness of the sauce but it was still delicious and very easy.  I decreased half-&-half to 3 oz. and added 2 oz. of milk.  Also decreased Parmesan cheese to 1/4 cup and Mozzarella to 1 cup.  Used 16 oz. of frozen, cooked and drained spinach instead of canned and omitted bacon bits.  I cut 4 chicken breasts into 4 pieces each to reduce cooking time and baked for 30-35 minutes at 400'.  Sauce was delicious!!! Everyone went back for a second helping...so I'd definitely make this again!  Wasn't too salty at all (perhaps because I didn't use bacon).

text:
I found this while looking for something to do with all the ingredients I had on hand. I made a few substitutions. Like fresh spinach for canned, garlic salt for minced garlic, and 4 cheese mexican for mozzarella. It's what I had on hand, and didn't want to go to the store. It turned out great anyway. I also pounded the chicken thin, and cooked in a little olive oil in a skillet. I was in a hurry and this seemed like a quick alternative to baking the chicken. It got compliments, and I really loved it.

DELISH! Saw all the comments for changes, but I try to make the recipes as written the first time to try them out as intended. This one is fantastic as-is. The Italian Seasoning was a little strong, but that may just be the brand I'm using. Tried it a second time with minor changes, came out the same. Used frozen spinach sted of canned, used canned mushrooms sted fresh. Next time I want to cube the chicken and maybe add some egg noodles? All around great recipe, the spinach really makes this a one dish meal.

text:
Like the others, I skipped step one.  I used only smoked mozzarella (only needed one cup) and the flavor was unbelievable.  My boys, age 11 and 14, (who love "good" food) said the mixture of flavors was really delicious!  I used fat free half and half, lo-fat cream of mushroom soup, crimini mushrooms, and frozen spinach (which I cooked with the mushrooms), and it all worked terrific!  Thank you for a new favorite- and a great way to get more veggies into my kids.

text:
This was absolutely delicious! My 6-yr-old son even loved it.  I cooked bacon on the stove (4 or 5 slices), set the bacon aside, and then cooked the chicken and garlic in the bacon grease.  I then sauteed the fresh spinach (one bag) and fresh mushrooms (sliced portabello) in the chicken and bacon fat. It tasted like something from a fancy restaurant.  I served over angel hair pasta with french bread and salad.  I can't wait to make it again. Thanks for such a wonderful recipe!

This is my review, that I have ever made on a recipe, but I just wanted to share a little of what I did.  It was an after thought but I still did it. Which was to add a fresh sliced tomato to the top of the Casserole, then sprinkled a little more shredded Colby cheese on top of the tomato.  It added color and flavor.  I also used cream of chicken and I layered Half spinach and half broccoli to the bottom layer. I was really good.  The chicken I pounded to about 1/2 inch thickness.  It was so tender. Great recipe!!   It is a keeper!!  Thanks

text:
Will make many more times. Followed others suggestions and sauteed fresh spinach & mushrooms w/ butter, garlic & wine.  Put that on the bottom of pan, added raw chicken (next time I will dice first) sauce on top and then topped with real bacon pieces (made on the stove top).  Cooked at 350 for 30 covered, took out, added mozzarella and cooked another 10 uncovered.  Fantastic and lots of flavor.

text:
Used 6 large (Costco) frozen chicken breasts put over a bunch of spinach and a cup of sliced fresh mushrooms and put in the oven while I prepared the sauce. I used a large can of mushroom soup double d everything else, but used a pkg of Italian Seasoning and baked for 45 minutes. Then put the mozzarella cheese on top and baked for 15 more minutes. Microwaved  fresh crispy bacon to serve on the side, because not everyone in the family is not thrilled with bacon, but all the family used it on top. Everyone praised the meal!. Thanks for the recipe! Next time I might prepare some egg noodles to put the extra sauce on top of.

This was delicious! city:

region:

country:
None
text:
Really liked this as did my kids.  Do not use canned spinach EVER and do not use canned mushrooms EvER. Cooked bacon and then sauted chicken in some of the bacon grease with garlic salt. Put chicken aside and sauted muschrooms ,garlic and green onion in butter and added white wine then added the spinach (whole bag) till it reduced a little and squirted some lemon on it.  dumped it all on chicken and diced up a little tomato for color and threw that in too.  Bake for 30 and tossed some mozz cheese and baked till cheese turn golden.  Served over bow ties and nuke some green beans.  I did use Half and Half cuz I had some but I would use non fat milk to save on calories next time.

userID:
3175988
Display Name:
GoCubsGo
isPro:
False
followersCount:
1
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
206
favoritesCount:

recipesCount:

reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5106103.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made a healthier version that did not suffer at all!  I'm a firm believer in fresh is better so I used a whole bag of fresh spinach and fried 4 strips of bacon.  To avoid immediate cardiac arrest, I used skim milk instead of half and half, only 1 cup of mozzarella, and Healthy Request mushroom soup.  It was delicious!  If you really want to cut calories, you could even omit the bacon and mozzarella because the rest of the ingredients were so flavorful together.  Still no substitute for butter though! :)  I also skipped the first two steps (no need to cook the chicken first) and started by sauteing the mushrooms and spinach in a little butter.  I then mixed in the other ingredients with a splash of white wine.  I arranged the chicken in a casserole dish and dumped the sauce over the top, followed by the crumbled bacon.  I baked at 400 for 25 minutes covered, then topped with mozz and baked 10 minutes more uncovered.  I would call this a chicken bake instead of a casserole, but I will make it over and over.

The ingredient changes I made was to use fresh spinach instead of canned and used cream intead of half and half.  I also mixed mixed all the ingredients together except for the moz cheese and cut the chicken up before baking it.  I then paired it with linguine because it needs either a pasta or rice to go with it.  When making it I didn't know if it would be "saucy" enough but it was just right.  My family really liked it except for my 11 year old but he can be pretty picky.  I will be making it again.

city:

country:
None
text:
I love this recipe. It's also in my "Somersize" diet. I cooked it for company last night and served over angel hair pasta. I substituted frozen spinach for canned and followed an earlier review and simply sauteed the spinach and mushrooms with butter and garlic, placed in dish, then layered cubed, raw chicken over it, then mixed the sauce over the top of it all. I then baked at 350 for 30 minutes (until the chicken was done), then layered sliced fresh mozzarella on top and baked for another 20 minutes. Really, only 10 minutes would suffice. The ONLY reason I baked it so long is that our friends were running late. But the mozzarella lightly burned on top and looked as delicious as it tasted.

text:
I really enjoyed my altered version of this recipe.  I cooked 3 slices of bacon then sauteed the chicken in the bacon grease.  Then, I set it aside and sauteed the spinach and mushrooms.  I used a bag of baby spinach leaves and that was enough for me!  As others said placing the browned chicken on the spin/mush mix then topping the whole thing with the sauce seemed to keep the chicken moist.  I baked it in a convection oven uncovered for close to 40 min.(total) at 350.  However, my chicken breasts were v. thick.  I also used 1% milk, about half the parmesan cheese and only a sprinkling of mozz. on top the last 10 minutes.

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I enjoyed this recipe, but made several alterations, based on others reviews.  I reduced the garlic to two cloves, added about 1/3 cup white wine (I poured it right out of the bottle) to fresh spinach and mushrooms to saute, and another 1/4 cup white wine to sauce while cooking.  I used 1/4 cup cream, and 1/4 cup 2% milk instead of half and half.  Instead of baking the chicken, I cut into strips, and sauteed covered, until done.  I had no mozerella cheese, and substituted with gouda cheese (not smoked, very mild). I also used fresh parsley and chives (left over from other recipes) in place of italian seasoning. To add more color, I also diced one fresh tomato, and added the the mixture before baking.  Delightful!!!!!!!!!

Great casserole!  I gave it 4 star instead of 5 because I did alter the recipe as some other suggested.  I sauteed fresh spinach and the mushrooms in butter ahead of time and lined the bottom of the baking dish.  Then topped with uncooked chicken breasts and the sauce baked at 350 for 30 minutes.  I was cooking for 2, but did not reduce the amount of sauce just the number of chicken breasts.  It's great on egg noodles!

Display Name:
Caryl

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2612747.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
We loved this!!  It is one of the best chicken dishes I have ever had!  I made minor changes.  Browned the chicken in olive oil instead baking in the oven (yuck).  After melting the butter I sautéed the garlic and added onion, sliced into rings.  Then I added all the sacue ingredients to the garlic & onions.  I used milk instead of half & half.  Then I sautéed the mushrooms with a little olive oil in the same pan I used for browning the chicken.  Then I added a bag of FRESH spinach and poured a tiny bit of chicken broth over the mushrooms & spinach and cooked it for about a minute until it was soft.  Put the spinach mixture on the bottom of the baking dish, topped with chicken and then poured the sauce over all of it.  I put fresh shredded parmesean cheese on it instead of mozzarella.  Cooked it at 350 for 30 minutes.  Probably will cook only 20-25 min next time.  So yummy, it was unbelievable!!  I served it over rice.

I would have given this recipe five stars but not everyone thought so.  The women loved it.  The men said it was okay and I could serve it once every two or three months.  I added two extra chicken breasts to cover everyone so I doubled the recipe....except for the spinach.  I used two frozen and one can because I didn't have enough of the other. Rich enough, I didn't need the extra chicken breasts but now we have plenty for lunch tomorrow!  Expensive to make but it will be a nice change.  Thanks for the recipe!

text:
This meal was delicious, and was great for leftovers.  I doubled the recipe, which worked out good, because I put cooked egg noodles in the bottom of the pan before covering it with everything else.  Too much spinach for me, even though I'm a fan of spinach.  I bought a bag of frozen spinach and used the whole thing, although it still wasn't doubled the amount of spinach.  Next time I will use probably half the amount of spinach.  Everything else was great!  and the noodles were a must.  I put the cheese on during the last 10 minutes, and broiled for the last 2 mintues to make the cheese brown and crispy.  I also didn't add bacon, because I didn't think it would go well with the dish, and it still turned out great. I will be making this again!

userID:
3258397
Display Name:
honeybee007
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
2
favoritesCount:
77
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677172.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
My boyfriend said it was the best pasta! I'm really happy with the way it turned out. I took many of the suggestions but also changed a little here and there. I made 7 bacon strips on the stove (we love bacon!) Used the grease to cook the chicken (bite-sized pieces) and added the garlic. I cooked the chicken all the way through. In a bowl I made the sauce. Kept the sauce pretty close the recipe but added extra parmesean cheese (about 3/4 cup, 2% milk and mixed a cup of motzerella. Then I mixed the cooked chicken into the sauce. Cooked the spinich (a bag and a half of fresh spinich) and mushrooms (6 ounces) in the bacon and chicken juices, then added it to the bottom of the 9x9 pan. At first, you'll think it's WAY too much spinich, but it cooks down to very little. Added the chicken and sauce mixture, then the bacon, then the second cup of the motzerella cheese. Cooked it in the oven at 400 for about 23 mintues. I wouldn't change anything from what I did.

text:
this recipe was good but it did have some problems. i found that 1/4 cup butter was WAAAAAAAAAAAY too much because after i finished baking this dish, there was a thick layer of oil on top that was less than appetizing. another problem with this recipe is that the amount of italian seasoning called for is too much. the dish tasted medicinal because of it! i would cut it down to 1 tsp so that the herbs don't overwhelm the dish. i made it a second time with these changes and the dish was delicious. it was perfect served with some steamed rice. thanks for the recipe!

userID:
3017909
Display Name:
LAURIE
isPro:

61

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/218041.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was ok. I tried to simplify it as much as possible. I used frozen and thawed spinach that I mixed with sauteed mushrooms and seasoned with garlic salt and garlic powder. I cooked bacon in a skillet and set aside then cooked cubed chicken and 3 cloves of garlic in the same skillet. For the sauce I omitted the wine and used roasted garlic cream of mushroom soup, I also used milk instead of 1/2 and 1/2. I layered the chicken over the spinach and then the soup mix. I topped with the cheese and bacon covered and backed for 30 min at 350 and then uncovered and baked for another 15 min. It was decent but I won't make again.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2008-10-23T12:06:04.917

country:
None
text:
I just made this today for the family and my 8-year-old-vegetarian-child had 4 servings!! Yes, she decided to be a vegetarian 2 weeks ago, but I think this dish broke her streak!  I wanted a one dish meal so I added 8 oz of boiled rotini noodles to the bottom of a 13 x 9 lasagna pan. I doubled the sauce ingredients and added 3/4 c of Chardonnay instead of the lemon juice. I didn't have any bacon bits or mushrooms to add.  I layered the ingredients as directed except I used raw cubed chicken breast. I cooked the whole thing at 350 for 1 1/2 hours (I fell asleep). The casserole was covered with foil for the first 45 mins. The whole dish came out bubbly and golden brown! I'll make this again and will probably add some chopped red onion.

text:
I wanted something dfferent for dinner and this was it! Turned out really really great! Can't wait to eat the leftovers! My modifications were as follows: I used about 12 ounces of fresh spinach and sauteed it with butter, garlic and olive oil. Next time, I'll use more spinach, probably about 20 ounces so there is spinach on each bite. I cubed the raw chicken and put it right on top of the spinach. I did not precook the chicken. I doubled the sauce mixture because I served it with penne pasta and wanted enough to cover the pasta.  Probably didn't need to double the sauce, there was a good bit that I didn't use. I cooked it covered on 350 for about 30-45 minutes, then removed the cover, added the cheese and broiled it. Served over Penne with crusty bread and it was fantastic! Thanks for a great recipe!

userID:
500521
Display Name:
Maine Cook
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
49
favoritesCount:
352
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/289903.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This makes an attractive dish. I ended up using what I had so I had to adapt. I used frozen bagged spinach and like another reviewer I sauteed the spinach and mushrooms for a few minutes to get rid of some of the liquid. I sprayed with non-stick spray a 9x13 pan and spread the mushroom/spinach. I had about 2 chicken breasts. I cut this into 1/2-1" cubes, I sauteed these for about 3 minutes until nearly cooked through and spread them atop the spinach/mushroom layer. Then I used mushroom soup, milk, garlic, butter, italian seasoning and parmesan cheese to make the sauce because that is what was available. Smelled great. I poured this on top of the mushroom/spinach/chicken and then took a fork and pulled the sauce through a bit. I added the mozzarella and baked. Awesome!

2

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Good but chicken lacked flavor. After reading the recipe I thought the chicken will get its flavors from the sauce so I decided not to do too much to the chicken prior to baking it. I just sprinkled olive oil and salt on it yet this did not help. Maybe next time, I'll flatten the breast, coat with seasoned flour and cook a little less than 20 min. The chicken was juicy and the sauce was wonderful! Just wish I followed my intuition about seasoning the chicken. *I always use low sodium soups and no salt added butter - so I added quite a bit of salt to the sauce and it still came out needing more salt. When adding sauce to the spinach and mushrooms, it can turn bland when all mixed together. Just a warning =) Happy cooking!

text:
I made this recipe with 6 pieces of chicken breast, 8 ounces of mushroom, 3 cups of mozzarella cheese in 3qt dish.  I didn't have bacon bits, but I did have some pork belly. So I put the pork on the top of the chicken breast to bake at the beginning. It was really good. 

I had one chicken breast with the sauce left. So I sliced it up the next day, also sliced up two portbella mushroom, and added 1/4 half and half, to make florentine sauce to serve over fettuccini for me and my hubby. It was excellent.

text:
We really liked this recipe.  I had to substitute the half and half with milk.  And if you do that I would suggest adding a little bit extra milk, to make the sauce a little thinner.  I would also suggest covering the baking dish with aluminum foil while cooking to avoid the mozz. from turning brown and hard.  I too used frozen spinach instead of the canned.  We served it atop rotini, and it was yummy.  Very simple, very easy.  Thanks!

text:
the blend of flavors was wonderful!! My husband loved it! I used frozen spinach.  I doubled and sauteed the mushrooms and added sauteed onions as well. I cut the italian seasoning in half as previously suggested. I used milk instead of cream and cut the butter in 1/2. I was trying to make it a little healthier. After cooking the seasoned chicken in a skillet I cut it up into larger chunks. I didn't have parmesan cheese so i added a little mozzarella to the sauce. It was quite tasty!! Will definitely make again. I didn't put the noodles in the layers as suggested by some but I made some plain bow tie to eat along with. I think I would of liked it better without the noodles. They took away from the blend of flavors and made it a little  bland. I think I will have fettucine on the side next time because the casserole by itself is delicious!

text:
Made this last night and it was tastier than I thought it would be.  My boyfriend and I actually liked it.  I cooked some rice on the side to eat with it.  I bought some tenders and cut those up and dropped them in some chicken broth to cook up.  Happened to have one left over breast from a roasted one bought at the grocery store and cut that up and added to the cooked tenders.  The changes I made were I did not put lemon juice in it.  And I used milk instead of half and half.  Also bought frozen spinach instead.  I would only use one box of spinach next time, as we are not avid spinach fans.  I thought the Italian Seasoning was too much and think I will halve that next time I make it.  I made my own bacon bits instead of using the jar ones.  Overall it was a very good recipe and got me to eat spinach.  Thanks for sharing.

We loved it and it will be part of our regular menu rotation around here! Even my picky kids ate it and loved it! Thanks for sharing.

text:
This recipe was great.  My dad absolutely ate it (he's a tough person to try new recipes!).  I did follow the other comments for using milk instead of half and half.  To cut the amount of fat, I also bought the fat free version of the cream of mushroom soup.  I also added in  some shredded carrots and fresh mushrooms and garlic.  I would say to double the sauce if you like it really saucy but for our family, it was fine.  We ate it over angel hair noodles.  Any type of pasta or rice will work fine for this recipe! Mahalo (Thanks) for this recipe!

text:
This was a hit! A couple of things though, i diced the chicken and didn't have time to bake as suggested, so I quickly pan fried them until golden.  I also used frozen spinach well squeezed of all juice.  I didn't bother with the bacon chips, and personally didn't mind or notice. It was great without them. Pan frying makes the whole meal finished and on the table to be served in about 30 minutes - too easy!! To make this a complete meal, start with rice on the base of your casserole dish (cooked that is) and follow the recipe from there.  It is a chicken floretine rice slice.  My husband loves this dish, did I mention that my husband loves this dish???

wow this was GREAT! i made a few changes to lessen the fat content. reduced the butter to 2T, used 2% milk instead of half and half, used a 1/8c of parmesean, didn't use any bacon, and only used 1c of the mozzerella. also i used chicken tenderloins and seasoned them with garlic powder and pepper when baking them the first time. This was a GREAT recipe!

This dish was a life saver!  Had to prepare for a Holiday potluck at work and I was able to get this dish together in no time at all.  Made a few changes--Spiced the chicken with garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, and salt.  Used monteray jack and cheddar cheese because I like a little more zest.  For a change, I have also substituted spinach for broccoli and nixed the mushrooms.  Love this dish!
